Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Because the operation is performed with the hand and is completely neglected in our region and time, while its science is strong but has little value, and only some small descriptions of it remain in the books of the ancients which are mostly wrong and lead to hesitation since his intentions are obscured and his strength and art are lost.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	It is evident to me that I should vitalize this treatise with a new order and arrangement according to the method of exposition, explanation, and abridgment; and also by providing illustrations of cautery instruments as well as other tools for the procedure both through addition and clarification in preparation which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The reason why there is a lack of skilled practitioners in our time is that the art of medicine is extensive and requires an understanding of anatomy before one can be proficient at it. This includes knowledge of the joints, their movements, and connections as well as separations; also the bones, nerves, tendons, their numbers, and exits; veins that pulse and ones that are still; and locations where they emerge.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And so Hippocrates says that the name is short but the work extensive, especially in the art of manual surgery.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already mentioned this in the introduction of this book; for those who are not aware of what we have discussed regarding anatomy, they may fall into error, which has led to the deaths of many, as I have witnessed. These individuals may be knowledgeable in one field but lack practical experience and scientific understanding.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	I once saw an inexperienced and foolish doctor make a mistake by incisiong an abscess with scrofula in the neck of a woman, he cut into some arteries in the neck causing a great flow of blood, which resulted in the woman's death while her maids held her.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	I witnessed another doctor who was about to remove a stone from a man's bladder, the stone was large and when he extracted it along with part of the bladder, the man died three days later.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	I have personally encountered such situations when asked to extract stones and knew that due to the size of the stone and the patient's condition, they would not survive.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	I observed another surgeon, who was paid by a duke in our land, operate on a castrated black man with a fracture in his hip. Due to the surgeon's ignorance, he extracted the fractured bone directly over the wound, using powders and splints with excessive force, not allowing any ventilation to the wound.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	Here is the translation of your provided text: 
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	I was called upon and prepared to loosen the ligatures, and it resulted in tranquility and thus alleviated his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, if the corruption has already spread to the limb and cannot be contained, it will continue to circulate within the limb until the patient is in danger.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	I witnessed another doctor who pierced a cancerous abscess, and it became ulcerated after some days, while its malignancy increased in the eyes of its master.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The reason for this is that the affected part is filled with melancholic humour, so it isn't necessary to cauterise the entire body but rather only the afflicted limb which should be entirely exposed.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, my children, it is necessary that the operation be divided into two parts: one part being an operation associated with health, and another work which is perilous in its greatest preparations.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	I have already expressed this throughout the entirety of this book where I explain an operation in which there is error and fear; it is necessary for you to keep this and leave that, so that these leaves do not prevent the way to speak and dishonour you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore, take up your weapons with solicitude and protection from God, and treat your patients with ease and fortitude.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	Use the best path, by God's grace, leading to salvation and praiseworthy success; leave behind those terrible diseases that are difficult to cure; put aside your weapons of fear so that doubt does not diminish your faith and reputation: for what remains is greater glory, both in this world and beyond with your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Galia has already mentioned in some of her warnings:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat any severe illness lest you be called bad doctors.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Here begins the division of the book, first of the first part:
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter orders the instruments that enter through the feet, their tools and cauterization implements, as well as what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part:
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter deals with dry and perforated wounds, the use of cupping glasses, abscesses, arrow extraction, and similar procedures, all categorized and ordered according to the types of instruments used.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division into three parts.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter is about restoration and dislocation, treating twisted limbs, and similar injuries; a chapter organized by the head to toe, and the types of instruments needed.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	On cauterization with fire and sharp medical instruments, as well as a reminder about the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With this it begins the treatise of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I would like you to tell me about the quality of that cautery's iron and its instruments, as well as in which cases cauterization is forbidden.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Thus I say that the discourse on the quality of cautery iron and its instruments is long and prolix, subtle due to science, and secretive; many wise people have already spoken about it at length, disagreeing among themselves, so a little from their discourses will suffice for me, fearing prolongations.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say this based on the words of that person, who has already experienced and discovered this many times.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not suitable for someone to come and treat this who has already been expelled and exercised in the chapter of cautery due to previous practice, and knows the diversity of human composition and the distribution of illnesses in their organs, as well as their causes, symptoms, and duration.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other compositions of the body, there should be no fear on your part, especially in diseases that are cold and moist, as all doctors have agreed upon them, and they do not disagree when judging these illnesses with cautery.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, my sons, that the secret of curing with cautery by fire and its goodness is due to the cauterizing action of medicine, for fire is simple, and its action only reaches the member being cauterized, causing very little harm to any other adjacent members.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	However, the action of caustic medicine reaches those members that are farther away from it and can easily cause an illness in a member which is difficult to heal and very harmful.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	Certainly! Here is my translation: 
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	However, there are superfluous uses of cautery in medicine due to the rapidity of its action and the strength of its effect.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible for the illness to return at some point in time, depending on the patient's constitution and the location of their illness, as well as their overall condition, and what is prepared within their body due to the accumulation of excesses present in them, and also by what has been acquired through food and similar causes; however, if the illness for which cautery is administered is a subtle one involving an organ with few excesses and humidities, like toothache or something similar, it may be that the pain does not return after cauterization, though this only applies in minor cases.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	The common belief is that cautery is the last resort in medicine, and this notion has some truth to it; it is not without reason that they say so, for those who understand it believe that there is no cure or benefit to be gained from any form of medicine or other treatment except cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	The reason for this is the opposite of what one might think; the idea that cautery is the final resort in medicine is only true when we have tried other methods of treatment for certain illnesses without success, and then finally administer cautery as a last resort, which proves to be beneficial.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And now from here on, remember that cauterization is the last resort in medicine, not according to the intention of those who understand it among common people and many foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	The ancient ones said that cauterization with gold is better than that of iron, and they mentioned this only because of the equality of gold and the excellence of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cauterization does not harm the arm, but this is not absolutely true, for I have tried it and found that it only has such an effect on some bodies without others, and cauterization with this [gold] is good and better than iron as they say; however when you perform cauterization with fire using gold, it's not clear to you because it is obscured according to the quantity you want due to the softness of gold, and because it prepares to receive heat; and if you place it over a flame, the gold melts from the fire, and this happens sometimes in the fire when some sheets [of gold] are caught by the artist in his work.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And so for this, cauterization with iron should be done more lightly and more precisely to the accuracy of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have arranged this chapter on cauterization according to chapters, and I have ordered those of the head among the feet, so that later, when someone inquires about it, he may know what he wishes from them.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization procedure addresses the excess moisture and coldness within the brain, which are two contributing factors. It is a remedy for various traumatic conditions such as severe headaches with discharge from parts of the eyes, ears, nose, mouth, and other areas; heavy sleeping; toothaches; sore throats; and many more ailments caused by coldness in general, including paralysis, strokes, and similar diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The procedure for this cauterization is as follows: First, instruct the patient to take a laxative medicine that will clear their bowels over three or four nights depending on the state of their health and age.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	Then instruct them to shave their head with a razor and make an incision between the two sides of their skull while seated on a wooden bench. Place your hands over their feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	Then place the edge of the razor blade from your palm over their nose.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, once your hands have reached the back of their head, mark this area with the probe. Then apply the olive-shaped cautery tool, which is designed like this:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that on the marked spot with a downward motion, so that your hand gradually applies pressure and you twist it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then gently remove your hand and observe the spot; if you see that any part of the skull is already exposed, along with some amount of brain matter, raise your hand, and don't return it to the same instrument or another like it until you have seen what I've instructed you to do.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take some salt and dissolve it over the wound, leaving it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place over it cotton soaked in vinegar, leaving it there until the burn's scab has been destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the wound with four-drug ointment until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they say that when the Roman plague is open, the arm gets better; for it's healthier and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the infection should be cauterized down to the bone, and keep applying the cautery until a part of the bone's surface has adhered.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And remove this which adheres to the bone, and it shall be cured.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	Others say that one should use the cautery to reach the back part, pressing strongly against the bone until it cracks. This is the form of small alpecin:" 
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And if the wound remains open for a long time, it must be treated before it becomes consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I have never seen these two types of cautery used completely, but some men do so out of fear; leave that, I believe, it is better for health when it is; because the head becomes weak due to the solution of continuity in it, as we have testified with other body parts, especially when the patient's head is of a frail nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cautery is safer and better in my opinion; I use that method and achieve healing with that work.
Capitol segon.	Chapter 2.
Del cauteri del cap.	On the cauterization of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When there is a chronic and prolonged pain in the entire head of a patient that has not been resolved with remedies, warres, cochias, capipurges, emplasters, guatz, cadels, gualinas or any other similar methods, especially if they have already been cauterized with one type of cautery we mentioned without finding benefit from any of those causes, consider this: whether the head of the patient is of a strong constitution in its nature; and it is not frail but there is much coldness, then cauterize it with another cautery similar to that [type] just a little.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that area on his horn with a cautery while the cord is divided.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the cord and expose the bone, as much as we have counted, then cauterize it with a cautery at its divided part behind the head in the area called 'vas', which is where the cupping glass is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And keep your hand there gently, without exposing the bone, for the patient will feel great pain here unlike any other cauterization on the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	I will explain this cautery in its place, for know that the cautery with which you cauterize the horns of the head and the occiput is a more subtle cautery than the one used to cauterize the top part of the head; and this is its shape.
Capitol ters.	Chapter three.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On the cauterization of non-ancient migraine.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When a hard pain arises on the side of the head, or spreading pain behind the eye, evacuate the brain with changing medicines and administer another cure that I have mentioned in different diseases; if all is without benefit, then cauterization comes into two ways: either it may be done with sharp medicine to burn off the affected part, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	Moreoever, cautery is a burning medicine; take some aloe and prepare it by cutting off both its ends.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then make an incision in the painful area on the temple with a lancet until you reach the bone, even if it is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then bind the patient tightly with a tourniquet for a short period of time; leave them like that for three hours, then release and remove the aloe, leaving the wound open for two to three days, and apply a hot poultice until the area becomes red.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish to do so, make this with some burning medicines which I have written about in the second book of burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Alternatively, the cauterization may be done with iron as follows; this is its shape:" (presumably describing an illustration)
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	It is called 'Clavus clavis' because its head has the form of a nail with some curvature and a small prominence in the middle.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Under the painful area, place your hand and keep it there - so that you do not stick to the glue under your hand - and rotate the small tool slowly but with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	If the quantity of glue stuck on you due to your mistake is as much that half of you is covered in it, then lift up your hand slowly so that the artery under your hand does not get glued for this would cause a blood flow issue.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Submerge a bandage in salt water and place it on the affected area for three days. Then put a moistened plaster over it and finally apply ointment until cured.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	Cauterize with the tip of the knife according to the appropriate cautery and be careful not to make an incision in this somewhat fresh wound.
Capitol quart.	Chapter four.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On the cauterization of an old wound.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat a wound as mentioned in the previous cure and as we have said about diseases, and it does not benefit from treatment, and at times due to the disease it is not sufficient what has been said about the first cautery with medicine or cautery by fire, then it will be necessary for you to ignite the knife-like cautery so that it becomes white hot; this means placing on top of the painful area along its length up to half a finger in size, or less than that; place your hand once and press hard enough to pierce the skin but not the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme. E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will bring to mind the treatment for accidental blood flow from archery according to its manner, in its place within this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this illness does not require such a strong cautery and the patient's body can tolerate it, cauterize them in the middle of their head as we have described earlier, and treat the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you apply the cautery as we mentioned in the chapter on archery injuries with two rods, this is the better and more suitable method of cauterization.

De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the cauterization of ear pain.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is pain in the ear due to congestion and it is treated with laxative remedies and other treatments as mentioned earlier in this section, but the pain persists, then apply the cautery known as 'punctual', which has the following form:" (likely describing a specific shape or design for the cauterization tool).
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Along with you, take the cautery of the root of the ear little by little after you have marked the place with ink.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if you cauterize these ten points all over the ear, and those that are close by, then treat the areas until they are healed.

De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cauterization of torture." 
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Turtura la cual es curada e am cauterización no es sino de las especies las cuales vienen per flecma, según que havemos dicho en las divisiones de las malautías.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the type that causes drying or nerve spasms.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat this type of torture with leeches, enemas, and gargling, and your treatment is not successful, it is necessary that you cauterize the patient with three cauteries: the first should be at the root of their ear, the second slightly below their temple, and the third at the junction of their two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	Place your cautery on the opposite side of the affected area, as softening will only occur in the part that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The method of cauterization is as follows: cauterize with the cautery on the right side at the top end of the ear, slightly above the crown of the head, and another one on the temple, its length being equal to the length of your little finger, and keep your hand with the cautery in place until half of the thickness of a chain link has been burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	This is the shape of the cautery, which resembles that of a razor; its form being flat on one side.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	It is however more subtle to use one that has fewer blades, and it should be sharpened a little less than usual.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with what is called 'procezit' before it heals.

De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot. Capitol .viii.	Chapter 5.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On the cauterization of forgetfulness done with a flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Give the patient at the beginning large cups of water and pills made with hellebore.

E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And leave it for some time, because this is the way of cauterization.

De cauterizacio de melencolia.	It seems we have reached a new section or chapter heading in the medieval medical treatise: "On the Cauterization of Melancholia." 
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholia are damp and weak humors, then cauterize that area with the cauteries we mentioned in cases of paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholia is an excess that leads to it and the patient's body is moist, then give them a drink that purifies their brain according to what was mentioned previously in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then scrape the patient's head, and then make a small hole over it in an appropriate manner, and place that hole on top of their head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And if the patient is 60 years old and has been paralyzed on all sides,
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then apply a liniment; it is better to use old sheep's milk for this.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And warm it up over the fire for an appropriate amount of time; this should be done at a mild temperature according to what they can bear.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then put it on the top of their head in the middle of the circle, and leave it there until it cools down.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	Do this to the patient once a week, along with their other treatments until they are healed; or if you wish, cauterize that area by making small points according to its size and without taking your hand off of an appropriately arranged cautery: this is a type of cautery which moistens the brain evenly.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then place that rotten arm in a broth of goose feathers.

De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Regarding the cauterization of hemorrhoids in children.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have identified the onset of hemorrhoids in a child through the signs I mentioned earlier, start and give them to drink whatever changes their head shape, while avoiding all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And let him bathe in warm water for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then command him to shave his head and cauterize that with a pointed cautery in the center of their head; then cauterize it with two cauteries on both temples if hemorrhoids are present in both children's anuses, or only one side if they're only present on one child's anus.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Make an incision with a pointed cautery on all the veins and arteries that are below this line; let these cauterizations be at this length, at the latitude of both temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And be cautious of blood fluxes when cauterizing; if you see blood flowing, stop it with any medicine that is available to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	I will come with the knowledge that is gained from extracting arrows and their removal, and being cautious of blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes, the neck is cauterized below the two bones with two heated cauteries.

De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	The title of the text, "De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas," translates to "On the cauterization of ancient tears." It appears that this section is about treating eye conditions or injuries related to the eyes and the medical procedures involved in such treatments. The mention of "lacrimas antiquas" suggests a focus on long-standing or chronic issues with the eyes, possibly even referring to old wounds or infections. 
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the tears of the eyes are always ancient and through the veins and arteries which are in an apparent place on the head outside and it is verified that this is phlegmatic superfluity, then cauterize it with a cautery which we have recounted at the beginning of hot water in the eyes chapter, use two cauteries below both temples and two more below both bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you need an addition, then cauterize it on the entire length of the eyelid towards the end of the eyebrow with a small cautery.

De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the cauterization of nasal odour.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat it with what we have said in the division and your treatment does not benefit, then prepare and give the patient to drink the decoctions for three nights; then shave his head, and cauterize him with a medium-sized olive oil cautery.

De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the use of cautery for softening eyelids.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid is softened due to illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with this lunar-shaped cautery; and this is its shape:" (presumably followed by an illustration).
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you wish to cauterize above both eyebrows, do so with two small cauteries in separate places, and let them extend from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	Let the length of each cautery be proportional to the amount of eyebrow that requires treatment.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	Do not press the cautery too hard with your hand, but rather according to how much of the upper eyelid requires adhesion.
Capitol .xvi.	The Roman numeral XVI indicates that this is Chapter 16 of the treatise.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On the use of cautery on the eyelid when hairs become ingrown within the eyelid.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the skin of the ulcer is converted into scabs inside it that are attached to the base of the ulcer, the cauterization can be done in two ways: either with fire or with caustic medicines.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you use cauterization with fire, ask the patient to shave his hair in the affected area just like those who are getting rid of it; and if you have removed their hair, then bind their ulcers with a bandage so that they cannot be hurt until the hairs grow back.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Therefore, when the hairs are born and grown out, place the patient's head in your lap, and then sign over their eyelids with a tattoo that is shaped like a myrtle leaf, and let the beginning of this sign be close to the hair.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then place hot lard from goose or bacon fat on the ulcer.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then ignite the following type of cautery:
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	Then cauterize it over the tattoo you have made on their eyelids, little by little, with small flames, so that the surface of the cornea is burned just like a myrtle leaf in appearance.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	Here is the translation of the sentence you provided:
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And so lift your hand and leave him for three days, then place a bandage on him with a border inside until the wound is healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if it returns because of the hair and the eyelid becomes softened, then do the cautery again on it just as you did initially.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are still on the eyelid, then cauterize it until it is raised to its natural position and smoothed so that the hair does not injure the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But if the cautery with caustic medicine is used, then instruct the patient to remove the hairs once they are elongated and smoothed, and then a piece of cloth in the shape of a myrtle leaf should be made.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	Then take one ounce of known and living caustic, or if you do not have this, then use these causes instead, and mix those causes well, making sure it is not cooled; then spread this over the cloth that was made in the shape of a myrtle leaf, and place it on one or both eyes; then place a cold egg white poultice under the eye, and keep the patient's head in your lap.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	Place your finger on the medicine and press it lightly, being careful not to cause any harm before the patient feels the stinging sensation of the medicine, for this sting is as sharp as fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	Once you perceive that the patient feels this burning sting, then remove your finger from the medicine and gently wipe it away with your little finger; once the stinging sensation subsides, take out the medicine and wash the area with water; then examine if the eyelid has been raised enough as if it were washed. You must apply a compression with fire or an incision, for this will suffice; but if not, return to the medicine at the location where you have not pressed the medicine yet without causing any harm until your operation is successful and the wound contracts.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Then place a bandage over the wound to eradicate the possibility of an infection, and then treat it with ointment or another remedy until it heals.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And if needed for your operation, you must be vigilant and ensure that none of the medicine falls into the wound; but if after a few days the eyelid becomes softened due to hair causing irritation in the eye, then repeat the medicine on the spot where the eyelid has become softened, and do so exactly as you did at the beginning. Then let him rest until he is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the shape of the myrtle leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And you should know that the odors of men are diversified according to their magnitude and smallness, and thus it is done with your contraction.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And the way of pharmacology will not be hidden to him who has studied this art.

De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cauterization of a fistula that is in the lacrimal duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula as described in the sections on diseases and your treatment does not bring relief, then it is necessary to cauterize it in this manner: instruct the patient to place their head on your knee, and let one of your assistants hold their head gently between his hands so that they are neither uncomfortable nor agitated.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	Then place a piece of white wool or cotton soaked in saliva on their eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then take the cautery, which is shaped like this:" (it seems likely that some kind of visual representation or diagram would follow here)
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	The which is convex, just like a reed or an eagle's feather, from one end of which the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you penetrate inside through the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And it will emerge as it was introduced.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, the one that is convex is better suited for this work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	Then press on the fistula if it is open, pull out its contents and dry it.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then make an opening in it and remove the obstruction.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place on it the cautery which is well ignited, and keep your hand near that of the patient at a small distance from the cautery's edge close to their nose, so as not to burn yourself or disturb them, then press the cautery against the wound and corrupt (destroy) it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And if at the beginning of your cauterization process bone is exposed, it's fine; otherwise, repeat the cautery once or twice as needed; and leave it like that for three days, then place a cotton pad on top and around it with desiccant ointment until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if eleven days have passed and it is not healed, then apply a corrosive sharp medicine on him while the bone is uncovered and scraped according to what is suitable in its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	Another way of cauterizing a fistula which some ancient doctors said: reach the place of the fistula and open it; then put into that opening a thin piece of cloth, the shape of which is subtle, and place in that a quantity of one ounce of molten lead; hold your hand steadily with good retention so as not to harm the patient for fear that the molten lead goes inside his wound; cover the patient's wound with cotton wool or water, because lead hardens the fistula site and heals it by an astonishing cure.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	If the fistula is healed with what we have mentioned about cauterization and cure, then it's good; if not, then it is necessary to administer drainage through the nose by reducing the fistula into the body of the nose as follows in its proper place.

De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cauterization of the anal fissure.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Sometimes there occur fissures on the lips, especially those of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you treat those fractures with what we have discussed in the previous sections and your treatment is not successful, then apply the small knife-like cautery as follows...
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And let its cavity be according to the delicacy of the cut.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place that whetstone carefully into those fractures until the cautery reaches the bottom of the fracture.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	Then treat it with ointment until it is healed.

De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	The full Latinate passage would be:
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat. De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the cauterization of teeth and on softening of arteries.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the arteries are softened due to moisture and teeth are affected by decay, and you treat them with medicines but they don't work, then place the patient's head in your lap, and take a cautery with the shape that will be described below, quickly insert the cauterization probe into that tooth, and hold it there until the patient feels the heat of the fire reaching the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then remove your hand, and repeat the cauterization several times as you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then have the patient rinse their mouth with salt water and hold it there for an hour; afterward, dry it up because the decayed tooth is sealed, the softened gum is tightened, and the corrupting moisture is dried out.

De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is due to coldness or when there's a cold wind or worm in it, and you cannot treat it with medicine, the cauterization of that area can be done in two ways: either with cow dung or with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterization with cow dung involves taking fresh cow dung and wrapping it around the end of an iron rod; then you immerse this in hot cow dung, and quickly place it on the painful tooth until it cools down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	Repeat this process several times until the virtue of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	If you want, soak wool or cotton in the aforementioned cow dung and place it on the painful tooth; then put an ignited iron rod on top of this until the iron reaches the core of the dental cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, be careful with the caustic substance of antimony or iron, and ensure there is no food residue in their mouth, as its acidity may not reach the patient's mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then, shape the cauterizer according to what is needed and place it on the tooth while holding your hand over it until the cauterizer cools down; repeat this process several times a day or on alternate days if the pain persists.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And when the patient feels pressure from that cautery, they should fill their mouth with good vinegar and hold it for an hour before spitting it out; this is the form of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	Cauterize any extremity that you see fit to do so.

De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Chapter 22: On the cauterization of extrophulos.

De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the cauterization of vocal cords and the treatment for stuttering.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When moisture accumulates in the lungs, especially when it is caused by a cold constitution, the patient should be evacuated at the beginning with laxative medicines, and then cauterize where necessary on the larynx.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	Be sure not to bring the cautery close to the larynx, nor burn its membrane except slightly.

Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When a pulmonary disease is caused by cold dampness and the patient has no fever or cough, and it is an old illness, then you should cauterize him with two pointed cauteries on the fork bone in the place between the lions and calves; and another one in the middle of the foot between the two bones. The cautery must be shaped like a nail according to what was said before.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas. Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25. 
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the humerus is dislocated due to lubricating humidity and is not secured during its return, you must guide its dislocation so that it returns to its usual position. Then, with a small movement, displace it again so that it evens out as we have witnessed. In this case, you first need to reduce the dislocation and then turn the patient onto their back or side; lift your elbow which is located inside the armpit to the areas above the fingers of your left hand if the joint is dislocated internally.
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	Then use a cauterization tool with two points; this is how it should look like...
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	Cauterize the elbow so that it penetrates to the other side; this will create a figure-of-eight shape with two points of cauterization.
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And be subtle according to the amount of tendon; this is how it should look like...
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	In some cases, this count is adjusted accordingly and for this reason there are eight points of cauterization.
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	Then place on the cauterization point some warm salt porridge, and then ensure the patient rests, keeping the affected limb still for some time until it is comfortable again.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	When the dislocation is in the upper parts of the body and this procedure has been performed, then cauterize over the muscle with a pointed cautery or several small pointed cauteries, for the joint will be strengthened, moisture will be removed, and the patient will recover their health.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26. 
De cauterizacio del stomac.	De cauterizacio del stomac.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When inflammation and excess moisture occur in the stomach, leading to an abnormal change in its natural condition and the multiplication of harmful substances within it, if you continue with the treatment methods without consulting further, then place the patient on their back and extend their arms and legs. Then cauterize that area with three cautery instruments: one below the feet, about a finger's length long, and two more at either side of the first one, creating a triangular shape; ensure there is no overlap between them which would cause burning.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cauterization is to be equal to twice the thickness of a rope.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And the shape of the cautery should be according to this addition. If you wish, you may cauterize with a larger cautery in the middle of the stomach following this circular shape.
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	Cauterize the stomach by applying this method to those who are afraid of such a procedure: you should mark the stomach with a needle in the desired amount of points, and then cauterize these points with a cautery tool. Treat any resulting wounds with previous prescribed methods until they are healed.

De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	De cauterizacio del fietge fret.

De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	Regarding the perforation of abscesses on the liver using a cautery instrument." 
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat. E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if the abscess is in the kidney's membrane, there will be severe pain that often tires out doctors during treatment.

De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	On cauterization of the mouth.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When you treat a patient's mouth ailment using the method we described earlier for internal treatment and do not see improvement, then cauterization is performed in three ways, all of which are effective. The first way involves making three or four cauterizations along the length of the mouth, following the pattern of kidney cauterizations that was previously mentioned.
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment.	And between each cautery, make the size of one finger or a little more, and the arrangement of the cauteries should be in the same way as we mentioned for the cauterization of the liver.
E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	Do not apply your hand to the cautery yourself; let the patient lie on their back.
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	There is another method of cauterization which involves igniting the cautery with two wick supports, as we have mentioned in the chapter on muscle dislocation. Raise the bed's headboard to a height that allows you to treat the patient lying on their left side.
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	Let the elevation of the bed's headboard be proportionate to the length of the patient's body so that cauterization can be performed according to the body's latitude.
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	Then insert the two wick supports, ignited beforehand, into the space where you have raised the bed's headboard on the other side.
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	Then withdraw the cautery, after which four cauteries will have been performed.
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	If you wish to use a cautery with three wick supports for the procedure...
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	And then you treat the cautery area that has been inactive for too many days because it is more beneficial than the other steps mentioned earlier in the treatment.

De cauterizacio de pes e de las coyssas.	Great attempt at translating! Here is my take on it:
