De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	On the extraction of thorns and other objects stuck in the throat, and on various causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Visible particles adhering in the throat, such as fish bones or any other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Therefore, you must extract whatever is visible; press the tongue with an instrument in front of sunlight to make it obvious what is stuck in the throat.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And for that which is not visible and hidden in the throat, you must make the patient vomit before the food is digested in the stomach; for often the cause attached to the throat will be removed by vomiting; or have the patient swallow a piece of napkin, a bit of lettuce stalk, or a piece of dry bread; or take a piece of dried marine sponge and tie it strongly with bile (gall), then let the patient swallow that, as when it reaches the place where thorns are extracted, they will be carried away.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquellas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma: 
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And whether it is bigger than a radish or smaller, and at its end there is a cavity which you insert into their mouth with ease.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	Raise the patient's head upwards, and be careful not to touch their neck bone in case it affects their body and breaks either the bone or spine, so let the doctor handle that with his hands.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	However, if the patient is better and understands the location of the attached cause, then push downwards and pull your hand with the tool upwards, according to how much the hole has been prepared.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	On the extraction of leeches attached to the throat.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When the leech is treated with what we have said in the division of cure by medicine and not by surgery, consider it then on the patient's throat under the sun since you have compressed their tongue with an instrument that we have described.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	So if you see the leech, extract it with either a small hook or a thin delicate gesture properly.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	Here is the translation of the first source sentence: 
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, so that he falls asleep.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	Another way to perform the operation through fumigation is as follows: take a bowl containing burning coals and cover it with a cloth that has an opening in the middle, into which you place the end of the instrument; then proceed with the fumigation; have the patient put their mouth on the end of the tube, and close their mouth so that the fumigation does not escape until you know that the fumigation has reached the blood vessels, because as soon as this happens the patient will fall asleep.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	If this does not work, then repeat the fumigation several times; prevent the patient from drinking and eating salty or acidic foods; do not let them drink water; it is necessary to follow this regimen.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	This is the shape of the instrument used to remove blood from the veins when it is visible; it looks like a pair of forceps at times, but with some curvature in its design.
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	Which is placed on the vein and its end resembles the beak of a stork; it has been serrated by a file, so that when it presses against something, it does not slip.
Capitol .xl.	Title: Chapter 40. 
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the summary of the sermon regarding appreciation of abscesses and the sectioning of them.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Abscesses are special marks, of many shapes, according to their recollection, each described in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in their perforation and sectioning due to two methods: one is specific to the type of abscess itself; and another considers what it has absorbed from moistures.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	The second method is based on the locations where accidents occur in the body, as an abscess on the head differs from that on the buttocks; an abscess on a fleshy area varies from one at a joint; and each requires its own judgment for operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	Most abscesses should not be perforated but instead allowed to mature or heal on their own.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	Other abscesses should be pierced when they are hard and do not mature according to their fullness; this includes abscesses near joints, as an abscess by a joint prolongs the healing process until you can treat its cause, which is often corruption of the ligaments or nerves of that joint, leading to contraction of that limb; or it is close to a principal member, and delaying perforation while awaiting maturation may damage the principal member; or it is near the buttocks, so pierce this one before it matures; do not pierce harshly when digestion is incomplete, but rather wait for one near the buttocks, so you do not harm the perineum and prolong healing of the interior parts of the buttocks, resulting in a fistula, or that it be done in its term without being cured.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And when you know that the abscess has settled in a place below the sore and coming from the cure of the swelling.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And the abscess may appear in the depth of the flesh or body, whether on parts of the hands or feet, and also in places like joints, cords of nerves, tendons; and finally, in all other similar locations where there is no reflection (of light); for in those places that have a reflection, use perforation according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the abscess is in a fleshy place, it is better to delay its perforation until its digestion has been confirmed according to what we have said; for if you perforate it before this time, the pus of the poor man will be prolonged and full of dirt, and perhaps its edges are hardened and its depth too deep.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some abscesses are perforated according to the width of the flesh or body due to necessity, or depending on that which the affected member requires.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And make sure to administer a small perforation for small abscesses, large perforations for big abscesses, and multiple incisions according to the variety of sizes of the abscesses.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And for them [the intestines or hernias], a circular section and a crescent-shaped section are applied, and similar things.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	For one who does not have such conditions as these [i.e., the patient has only superficial abscesses and leukomalia], you should make a shallow or flat perforation only.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the abscess is large and has already collected a lot of pus, pierce it and do not hesitate to remove all the bad [pus] at that time; first extract a small part from it, then wipe the abscess with something on the next day, and then extract a larger part, and so do this many times according to its extent until it is completely drained.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is a young child, or a pregnant woman, or an infant, or an elderly person in their dotage [i.e., with poor mental faculties], for often the animal spirit is dissolved by the expulsion of pus and the patient can die quite quickly from it; you should operate on them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Pay great attention to this chapter, and for your perforation when you pierce these abscesses, make sure that the wounds are cleaned and consider whether the wound of the abscess is small or flat; if it is a minor wound, then apply either leek juice or old wine [to disinfect]; if the abscess is large and there are many cracks in the puncture, then you should plug each opening so they do not join together.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	Here is the translation of your provided text: 
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the bleeding of the wound persists, then you must administer treatment and healing, and use powders that I have recommended in various places within this our book and its divisions.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	If it is wintertime and the location of the abscess is an area rich in nerves, then you must wrap powders in cloth soaked with warm oil, and place them over these spots.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is summer and the areas are fleshy, then you must apply powders moistened with cold water and oil or with vinegar and oil, and keep doing this until the third day, as we have mentioned earlier. Then you must open up the abscess and clean it thoroughly before applying any treatment suitable for its healing until complete recovery.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is all that is necessary for understanding the general treatment of abscesses; however, according to the way of distinction I have already mentioned, every abscess must be treated in a unique manner as described in its own individual chapter.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41:" (This is likely the start of Chapter 41, but there's no specific text associated with it.)
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Regarding the incision of abscesses that appear on the head." (I've interpreted "del cap" as referring to the head, which makes sense in this context.)
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the back of the head, there are small pustules, which are like nodules containing layers that form them; and their types are varied.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And they have dots, from which there is discharge, and this discharge contains a fluid similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And from these [discharges], there are those that contain a fluid resembling dust, and similar to it; and then there are stony, hard ones.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the treatment of all [conditions], and in extracting these [discharges], there is no fear, as you should not cause any inconvenience during the extraction process.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	The operation for treating these [conditions] is that you should express them using an instrument suitable for the purpose, which is called an 'entromes', knowing what it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if what is contained [in the entromes] is moist or fluidic, then make an incision on it according to its length for a shallow section in this manner:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	Begin the section from point B to point G. Once the moisture is evacuated, you should excise that skin which contains this moisture, ensuring that you leave behind no cause [of the condition], for if any hidden causes remain, they will return.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if there is an abscess with greasy nodes, then you should cut it open like this:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	It has a cross-shaped section, and you have grasped it between the two lips of the incision and cut it all around, and exert your strength in pulling out the tunic that contains it.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if your efforts cause resistance, then do what I told you first.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	Similarly, do the same for an abscess with hardened sections during the healing process as we have mentioned earlier; and the incision over a hardened abscess is lighter because it has less blood and moisture.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes there are some abscesses that appear on the head in certain men with little moisture; this is caused by me cutting open an abscess on the head of an old woman and finding it hardened like a hard pebble that could not be broken, and if anyone were to hit it, they would cause pain.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in other abscesses that appear on the head, unlike this one, as well as abscesses that occur on children's heads and behind their ears, you should make only a shallow incision for all of these.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And make an incision in those of the lower part of their legs, so that their body is relieved and lowered to the lowest parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	Then cure those with what you deem appropriate for healing.
Capitol .xlii.	The number 42, possibly indicating a chapter or section heading in the treatise. Is there another sentence you would like me to translate?
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	Regarding the excision of scrofula that occurs on the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Small pustules often accompany these abscesses on the neck, under the armpits, and in the angles of the joints, and sometimes they occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur on the neck, they are spots generated among them, and every scrofula of this kind is within its own tunic, just as in the glands and abscesses of the head, as we have explained.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	The types of these scrofula are spots, some being stony and hard, others containing moisture, and those that are malignant do not respond to healing.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	In this case, when you see good disposition in the Touching (presumably a medical procedure), and the color of what is manifested resembles that of the spot, and it spreads to all parts, but does not affect the spinal cord nerves or veins or arteries, and has no depth, then treat it with shallow cuts over the area above the injury on the body's surface, between lines G and B. Remove this completely, extracting its two edges from the spot outwards by an inch or more if needed, as we said for abscesses of the head; extract it gradually.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is important to exercise caution so that the vein or nerve is not cut.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	If the spatula does not have a sharp edge and you cannot properly place your hand for incision, or if it disturbs the patient, and you accidentally cut something that should not be cut; then if you were to cut through a vein or artery and prevent yourself from continuing the operation, apply crushed alum or other powders that stop bleeding on the wound, press firmly on it, and leave until the sharpness of the abscess is relieved, and the wound becomes softer and begins to swell.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When blood is cut off.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	So return to your operation before it's completed.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	Then examine with your finger if there is any remaining cause of the other small sores, therefore cut and clean them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it is in the root of the large sore, be careful not to cut that sore with its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Take care to remove it with a strong bent hook, and leave it until it falls out by itself without causing harm.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	And then fill the wound with old cotton that you have already dipped in Egyptian ointment, and treat it accordingly.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you excise the entire scrofula, make sure that you align the two lips of the wound and sew them together as soon as possible so that nothing superfluous remains.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	However, if you see that there is remaining superfluous matter due to the size of the scrofula, it is necessary that you understand how to excise its root and remove it, then perform the suture as mentioned above.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	For those scrofulas that contain moisture, pierce them with a superficial puncture here where it appears to you as the site of maturation, and make a puncture like this which seeps out the puss from below the body, as we have mentioned before.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	Then apply the puncture, cover it with ointment and similar substances to those mentioned earlier, so that it corrodes what remains of the corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And then when you see the wound cleaned, treat it with an ointment made from generative flesh until it is fully healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter 43.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	On the incision of an accidental abscess within the neck.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients would say that this incision is made on the abscess itself (or "pimple"), and I have not seen anyone in our land who has had it done before.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the transcription of their speech:
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	In the case of a patient with an abscess on their chin (or "jaw"), it is advisable to avoid extracting the pimple as it can damage the veins and major vessels in that area.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	For those with abscesses caused by scurvy (or "bad blood") in the mouth or neck or behind their ears but not on their temple, it is necessary to use an incision method to avoid the loss that occurs due to perforation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we wish to do this, it is necessary that we incise the abscess below three circles of the abscess itself or with four small incisions in between two circles by number; the incision must be made at an angle and not on the cartilage as this area lacks flesh and has fewer blood vessels.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then make an incision in the testicles as we have explained; it is meant to be done according to the section of the canal, using a flame which will come out from that which is ruptured and by the excision of the voice.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And leave the wound open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Once the time has come when a perforation is feared, add two lips of the wound's edges together, and stitch only where it is cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	Then administer medicines that will help produce flesh until it is healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	Albucasis says that the end of this discourse which we have explained is not other than some veins in those kinds of abscesses having already invaded the patient's throat, and the patient has come to death, and their breath is interrupted, and some go to incise the epiglottis so that the patient can breathe at the place of the wound for a little while, and are saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for this I will command to leave the wound open until the evil of the disease is consumed; and its evil lasts three days; then after that I will command to close it with a stitch, and heal it until it is healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore, I was confessed that she had not incised a vein or artery, and the wind came out of the wound, and I cured her before she was healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And the servant did not die but rather lost her voice, and after some days, she returned to better health.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that in the section of the navel, there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	The number "Capitol .xliv." likely refers to chapter 44 in this medieval medical treatise or document. It seems that the text you provided is divided into chapters, with each chapter discussing different aspects of medical treatments or procedures. The content appears to be quite detailed and specific, providing instructions on various medical practices during that era.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Regarding the section on abscesses that occur outside of the navel, which is called an inguinal hernia." 
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	Here is my translation of your provided text: 
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it is divided into two ways, either naturally or accidentally.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	In the natural case, there is nothing to be cured.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	As for the accidental case, it is divided into two ways: one is similar to fatty tumors, and the other way is like an abscess caused by arterial obstruction, which brings about fear.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	One should not make presumptions regarding the use of iron [instruments] on him unless it is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	You must first examine and investigate it with your hands, and if you find it to be similar to a fatty tumor, and it is not suspended by any veins, then you should cut into it like a node, removing it along with its skin and covering; but if it isn't, then the entire mass must be examined, and then treat the area with whatever curative measures are necessary until it is healed.

De seccio de las specias de nodes.	De seccio de las specias de nodes.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	There are many types of nodules, as I have already mentioned all the species of them in the division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And now, I must recount the distinction between nodules and eruptions to eliminate any doubt.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	So I say that an eruption is a quality and a fever with violent pains when the ebullition of superfluidity is suppressed; it is completed by putrefaction at which point the fever, pain, and heat cease.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But a nodule is not a quality nor fever nor pain; consider that of the lion which it has in its own sac.

Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	If the pulsating vein is opposite to it, or not pulsating, then you cauterize and fill the place with three-part vitriol poultice, leaving it tight for two days or three until the sore scabs over and the blood stops seeping; then return to cut away what remains broken of the tumor.

Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	On the treatment of male breasts, which resemble those of females.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Some men's breasts are swollen due to the fullness of sleep and they begin to grow hair; then their breasts become enlarged like female breasts but stay hairy.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And for those who wish to undergo this procedure, it is necessary that you cut along the lunar line from point B to point G and then remove all flesh until it is clean; fill the wound with red medicine and sew together the two lips of the wound so that it may heal.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the breast sags towards the armpit and is softened by its size as in women, then it should be cut into two halves along its upper part, with two sections resembling a lunar shape, each containing the other at their ends so that the major line contains the minor one like this from point B to point G. Then remove the flesh between the two lips of the wound and extract the fat; finally apply what we have said about sutures and powders as required for healing until it is cured.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Certainly! Here is the translation of the provided sentence: 
Capitol .xlviii.	It seems that you've provided me with a medical manuscript written in an archaic language resembling several Romance languages. Here is my translation of your provided text into modern English: 
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	These apostemata that develop under the armpit are a kind of scrofula, hard, and containing pus.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	And among these, some contain moisture; and those that contain moisture should be incised with a lunar section according to this figure: from the line of G to the line of B. And when all the unhealthy matter is evacuated from the apostemata, then you fill it with old cotton wool and leave it for another day.
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	Then let the cotton be removed and cured with appropriate ointment until it is healed.
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	And if the apostemata is of the kind that causes nodules and scrofula, then you incise it in the same way as we have described for scrofula.
May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.	But if the plague has extended so that it causes putrefaction, then administer to him the cautery as we have previously described.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	On the incision of apostemata that occur by an artery or a vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When the artery is ruptured and the cord above it has healed, often an abscess occurs afterward. The signs by which you can recognize whether inflammation or abscess are arterial or venous: when the abscess results from a rupture of an artery, there is usually pain in the heart region; and if you press the abscess with your fingers, you hear a hissing sound in them.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that which is venous appears round near the heart region.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	Making an incision over this abscess is a mistake, especially in those that are below the armpits, the shoulders, the neck, and many places on the body; it is very large so its cure with iron should be avoided, and incisions made at the extremities or head must also be evaded.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	But if it is due to the obstruction of the orifice of the artery, then make an incision on the cord's side over the pain; then open the incision with hooks and expose the artery, removing its membranes so that it may be visible.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	Then place on it a needle and make the latter penetrate to the other side; tie the artery with double thread in two places, which reminds you that when two arteries must be extracted, those in the temples should be taken out.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And then pierce the area that is between two ligaments with a spatula until the blood in it is drained out, and let the abscess dissolve.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then provide treatment where pus has been generated to prevent the ligaments from falling apart; and treat it with appropriate poultices until it is healed.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	If there is an abscess due to the severing of a vein, you should cover it as much as possible with your hand and then insert the needle under the space that has been covered by your hand, making it penetrate; let the thread pass through that in such a way that you remove that from one side, and then tie up the abscess using a ligature according to what I have told you previously regarding the grapevine ligament.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	However, if you fear that the thread will be pulled out, insert a sinew with that needle under all of the abscess on top of the previous incision made by the needle, and then tighten your threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Then dry the abscess in its middle part so that when what is inside it comes out, you should cut off the excess thread, leaving the binding of the threads.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Then place on them a poultice that you have soaked in wine and oil, and then apply the treatment made with herbs and ointments until they are healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter 1: On Abscesses that occur due to nerve inflammation.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Abscesses can occur in arteries and veins, similarly, abscesses form on nerves when they are subjected to pressure or when excessive strain is applied during work, likewise.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	Most commonly, abscesses form in the joints of the fingers or toes, or any other place where the bones are close to the surface.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	This type of abscess is severe and resembles the colour of the rest of the body. It often appears on hands or feet, and when it is intense, it can cause the patient to become stunned.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	An abscess does not form in the centre of the chest due to its proximity to vital organs; instead, it tends to spread outwards and never appears directly on the sides of the body.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Abscesses in joints should not be treated with iron as this may cause further contraction of the affected area.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	If there is someone with head or forehead pain caused by a cold wind, treat it with a hot iron.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	If there is a small abscess, then take scissors and cut it out from its root.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, then suspend it with a thread and remove the skin around it, and then stitch it closed. Secure the wound with stitches and treat it until it is healed.

De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	Regarding the incision for an abscess that occurs on the belly.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	Many people have spots on their bellies and other parts of the body which are called fungua due to their similarity to mushrooms, whose root is thin but whose head is thick; and sometimes these marks are small while at others they are large.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have seen one such person, and on their belly there were two growths which looked like mushrooms, and there was no difference between them except that the roots were white and thin.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And already the lips of those affected were turned inward and split open, with moisture constantly flowing from them.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	So I made incisions in them, finding one with eighteen ounces of pus and the other with six ounces.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And during the operation and incision process, consider that if the patient's body is moist, and the pus appears white, humid, with a subtle reddish tint, then you should use a wide spatula to make the incision, and have your cautery heated in the fire. You must ensure that multiple discharges of blood occur; if this happens, cauterize the wound.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	If you find the patient is fearful and timid, refrain from using iron instruments for incision. Instead, take a piece of freshly made lead wire, mold it into the shape described earlier, and leave it in place for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	Then adjust and secure the lead wire tightly in place. Remember, do not cease to apply pressure with the larger piece of lead; it must be strong enough to cut through by itself.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	However, if the pus is of a deep reddish color, then making an incision may be a cause for concern and fear, especially when it occurs in the belly.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	It is also possible that you divide him in half and then cauterize it so that he does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	Then cure the patient once the plague is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And be careful not to presume to cut into a tumor that is of dark color, with little feeling, and which seems light when probed, for it is abscessed cancer.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I will come with the memory of pain soon after this.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	On the treatment of the navel's protrusion.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	A navel's protrusion is caused by several reasons: first it can be caused by fractures of the cartilage above the abdomen which causes intestine or hernia to push through; second when there are damages in veins or arteries as mentioned before, blood starts flowing out and forms a hematoma that pushes organs out; thirdly when gas gets trapped inside.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	If it is caused by cartilage fractures and the intestine's or hernia's protrusion through the tissue then the hematoma has the same tone as our flesh, but causes extreme pain and can appear in various forms.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	Here is the translation of your provided text: 
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	When it is due to humidity, it is a lion and is not hidden when you press it with your hand, nor is it constricted or believed to be so.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is due to blood, then these signs will appear: the abscess turns black as it declines.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	However, if it is due to flesh, then it is a severe abscess, thick and hard, and it is located in a specific quantity.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is due to air (ventosity), then its touch is like that of a lion.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation on it is considered when the prominence of the navel is due to arterial blood or venous blood, or air; you should be prohibited from treating it, as there is fear and risk involved, just like what was taught in the chapter where I discussed abscesses caused by arteries and veins.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	If the navel's prominence is due to the intestine or hernia, you must instruct the patient to lie with their belly down and be extended; then, make a sign with thread around the entire navel, and command them to face towards your back while placing both hands on your shoulders; next, cut half of the abscess above in large pieces; then tie it around with strong flax or hemp in a decent tying manner.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have exposed the membrane, then take it with a clamp; and cut away its superfluities.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is contrary to your incision or vein, then surround that place with a thread, and return to your operation; take two needles and put strong threads through them, and insert the two needles into the circle you have made around the abscess in the manner of a cross, making them penetrate; and thus compress the abscess into four parts over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you wish, remove the needles and leave the place so that the flesh dries up and falls off by itself; or cut away that which has become thin and will dry out, and then treat it with something that is appropriate for wounds until it heals.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if there is a fleshy swelling or moisture in the navel, then treat the abscess as we have said, and draw out the blood or moisture that you find within it; and then heal it with something that covers and consolidates the area.

De curacio de cranc.	De curacio de cranc." translates to "For curing wounds." or "The treatment of injuries." 
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	Certainly! Here's my attempt at translating the provided text: 
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients said that sometimes when there is pain in an area where it is possible to eradicate it, like the pains that occur in the breasts or groin, and their similar parts of the body should be removed entirely, especially when they are small at the beginning.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	When an illness is old and severe, it should not be treated by anyone, as I have never seen nor experienced such a case myself.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation on the patient, as we have mentioned earlier, involves proceeding and performing a black bile purge occasionally; you should then bleed them if there is visible engorgement.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	Then prepare the patient for surgery by locating a suitable spot and prohibiting any tools that may be required during the operation from being placed within reach; you should thoroughly scrape the area with a good, sharp curved blade until there is nothing left of the roots.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	Let the blood flow and do not stop it lightly; squeeze the area and wipe away the thicker blood either with your hand or any suitable tool that is available to you.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if you encounter thick blood due to a cut in the vein or artery, then cauterize it until the flow of blood ceases, and then treat him with another cure so that he may be healed.

De curacio de ydropici.	On treating dropsy." 
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already discussed, in the previous section, the different types of water-related illnesses and their symptoms, as well as their treatment using medicines.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And the one that is treated with iron is solely the illness of dropsy (althitis), and it should not be confused with tympanites or pleurisy, as these are fatal conditions.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	When you have treated this type of dropsy accompanied by tympanites with medicine and it does not respond to your treatment, then consider the following: if the patient is already severely weakened or suffering from another form of dropsy, such as pleurisy, abdominal pain, or similar conditions, be cautious about using iron-based treatments. There are concerns regarding its safety.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	However, if you observe the patient with an abundance of vitality and no other illness except for dropsy alone (i.e., not children or elderly), then here is how to proceed with the operation: lift the patient between your arms, have them press their abdomen with one hand, directing the water towards a lower area below the navel, while you prepare a sharp instrument like this:" [Description of an instrument follows]
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	Here is the translation of the provided sentence: 
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the generation of hydrops (fluid retention) is due to kidney disease, then your incision should be three fingers to the left of the navel.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if its generation is due to the spleen, then your incision should be on the right side.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And you should not make an incision on the side where the patient wants to discharge superfluities (excess fluids), as it will run into that place.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	Then pierce it with the instrument through its entire length and introduce into that incision, then lift your hand to separate the peritoneum from the sipho (urinary bladder), removing a piece of flesh equivalent in size to a fingernail or thereabouts.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	Then pierce the sipho until you reach the peritoneum in an empty space, which is the water reservoir.

e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	It is similar to a thin silver cannula; made of silver or bronze or tin alloy with a small hole at its lower part and three holes along the sides—two on one side and one on the other. Its tip has been sharpened like a pen as follows:" [Here, describe the sharpening pattern.]

Capitol .lv.	Chapter 51.
De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	On the treatment of infants born with unperforated urethral openings.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Sometimes, among infants who are born from the belly of their mother and their genitals are not fully developed or lack a complete opening.
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Therefore, it is necessary to create an opening for them as soon as they are born with a sharp instrument like a lancet, in this manner:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	Then place in the opening a small lead plug and tie it there with thread for three days or four.
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	And when they want to urinate, it is released so that they may pee; then the plug is replaced.
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you do not place the lead plug, it is possible that urine that passes through the area will cause this to heal over.
Mays aquel del qual le trauc es streyt sia medicat am clavil de Plom, ayssi cum havem dit, per trops dias entro que sia amplificat.	May the person with a narrow fracture be treated with lead pins, as we have mentioned, for several days until it widens.
Mays aquels en les quals es le trauc no en son loc, so leditz, la qual causa es quar de aquels, aquel que es nat e·l trau es deves la fi del cap de la vergua per que no pot urinar a las partidas dedintz, entro que eleva la vergua am la sua ma a las partidas desus; e no es a lu generacio, per so quar le sperma no pot pervenir a la mayre segon rectitut, e es malautia mot laga.	For those whose penis is not in the correct position (i.e., bent) and this condition is caused by one of them being born with an injured foreskin which causes the end of the glans to die because it cannot urinate at certain parts within, even when lifting the penis using their hands; and there is no generation as sperm cannot reach the uterus accordingly, and such a disease is very serious.
E la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que·l malaute sia envessat sobre le sieu dos, e aprop exten le cap de la vergua de lu am la tua ma sinistra am vehement extraccio, e inscideys le cap del cap de la vergua del loc del perpucii am spatum agut, ayssi cum es inscizio de pluma, o que tu ne razas alcuna partida, per so que·l mieg de lu vengua semblant al cap de la vergua e que le trauc caia en le mieg loc segon que cove.	And the method of operation on him is to place the patient on their back and then extend his penis with your left hand using strong traction, and make an incision at the tip (i.e., glans) below the foreskin using a sharp scalpel, like cutting a quill, or let it split without damage so that the middle part of the penis similar to its head is cut and the fracture falls into the right place as needed.
E guarda te que en la tua operacio de flux de sanc, quar motas vetz accideys aquo; e pausa te a lu am aquo que abscindeys le sanc, e cura la plagua entro que si’ sanada.	And be careful when operating on blood flow issues because it may happen that you will cut him too much and he dies from this (i.e., excessive bleeding); so stop the bleeding using something and treat the wound until cured.
