E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And when the wound is wide and the intestine has come out, take care to reduce it gently back into its cavity with a movement that follows its natural shape; do so carefully in its proper place if at all possible.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	In cases where the rupture is extensive and located in the lower part of the abdomen, ensure that you make the patient lie on their back with their legs elevated higher than their head; if it's in the upper part of the abdomen, position their head and feet higher than the affected area.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	Similarly, when the rupture occurs in one of the two sides of the abdomen, always keep your attention and consideration focused on ensuring that the side with the wound is positioned higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And so ensure you apply this [treatment] to large wounds and moderate wounds.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	For smaller wounds, apply your prepared ointment or salve, then ask the patient to extend their arm with the wound completely exposed and carefully align the edges of the wound; finally, remove any foreign objects before sewing it up.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	This is the common method of suturing: once you have obtained a needle and thread (in an amount proportional to the size of the wound), allow only one end of the needle's eye/hole to protrude from the very tip of your ring finger, hold the needle firmly between two fingers, avoiding any contact with the thread's ends which should be held separately by another set of fingers; you are now ready to insert the needle into one side of the wound. Once this is done and both ends of the thread have been added together and both sides of the wound closed, there are four stitches.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	Then firmly grasp the doubled thread on either side of the needle's eye/hole, occasionally pulling on both ends simultaneously before bringing together both sides and closing the wound with a proper suture; leave only the width of your finger between them and insert another needle in one end; then tie this new needle to the first using thread; repeat these steps as necessary until you have closed the entire circumference of the wound.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	Here is the translation of your provided text: 
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And it is not necessary that the needle be inserted at two extreme points of the proximal end, for this reason: the flesh should not be incised lightly and the wound will heal before consolidation.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And it should not be prolonged with suture so that the wound is not prevented from consolidating.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	Then cut the ends of the needles so that they do not hurt the patient when sleeping; place over the suture expanded powders from all sides, which should cover the ends of the needles; and leave them there until you know that the wound has healed.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And this type of suture with needles is the most suitable for small wounds, as only one or two are needed to close them.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	The second type of suture is more comprehensive: it consists of administering a suture to the four corners, both ends of the proximal wound and two ends of the distal one, with a needle that should be thin and thick in texture.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	Then, once you have penetrated the four corners with the needle, bring back the needle from the same side it entered to make sure the thread comes out of the highest point on the wound, in a way that mimics surgical suture, where the threads are tied.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And place between each suture an amount equal to the thickness of the little finger.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	This suture is known as 'the men's suture'.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	With this type of suture, I managed to close the wound which had afflicted a man's abdomen after being stabbed with a knife. The wound was one palm in size and exposed the intestines for about two palms from the middle part towards one side; there was also a disruption in the middle of the member. So I reduced it afterwards since the intestine had been protruding through the wound for twenty-four hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	The wound healed within fifteen days or so and the patient recovered from it. He lived for many years afterwards and is now in good health.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	The other doctors had judged that he would not recover; but it happened miraculously without ointment, for there was no ointment or medicine applied to the wound, only pure honey twice a day and frequent washing with water until he healed.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	But I will describe two types of sutures, according to the account in the Bible.
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	And it is you who begin the suture of the wound, and insert the needle from outside to inside.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	Then, as the needle penetrates the wound and you place a piece of string along its length, both in width and depth, leave the end of the thread where you have inserted the needle; and make the other end of the thread penetrate from inside to outside at the other end of the wound.
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And when you have made that penetration, then make it penetrate again at the same end of the wound from outside to inside; leave the end of the thread which is on this side, and make the needle penetrate into the other end from inside to outside.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	Make the penetration penetrate with that thread you are using, and make it penetrate into the end of the wound which is on its inside part until everything penetrates.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	Then begin on this side and stitch with the end of the thread which is on the other side, extract the needle from the wound it has penetrated, and then reduce that (thread) to that wound and sew the end of the thread which is on the other side with this end of the wound; extract that (thread) from the wound which is on its part.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And do this once and again, do it another time as well before you stitch everything that is outside according to the example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	The essence of this suturing method is that you stitch with a simple suture technique, joining the hairs together as you would sew the skin. In this way, you pierce the navel once at one end of the thread and another time when your work is done.
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	The second type of suture, which is specifically mentioned by Guy of Chauliac and called 'sermo' in his work for the wounded, consists in suturing according to its half-length with a thread on which medicines are placed. They add each part to its comparable part that suits it best in nature; they apply one end of it to another one and the mirror image of both ends to the other end. It is done as I recommend to you.
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	Cover the needle with the corresponding end of the thread on the surface of the external part, and make it penetrate into the internal part of this only; then pass both ends of the thread there. Then turn the needle around and let it go from the outside to inside through both ends of the thread.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	And then you rotate each one, making the inside of each part penetrate into the outside at two extremes on different sides.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this manner of stitching is better than the common light stitch, it is the suture that I have previously mentioned.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the speech of Walter/Gualia.
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment. E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	And know that when the rupture is in the middle of the belly, then its stitching will be more difficult than for other parts of the belly.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	The treatment/judgement of plague is also the judgement for other diseases.

E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	And then place another ant nearby the first one, and do not stop making ants until you have enough to cover the entire wound.

E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	This method of suturing with ants is not only a matter of trust but also one of hope.

De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	On the healing of ulcers and fistulas:

And as I have mentioned before in the division, when I speak of diseases, any ulcer that does not heal and remains uncovered with flesh is due to one of these reasons: either it's caused by a lack of blood in the body; or it's malignant; or because there is hard flesh between it and the labia, preventing new flesh from forming; or it has thick pus; or the ulcer itself is putrid, and the matter around it is of poor quality; or the treatment used for healing is inappropriate; or when corruption occurs in the region, resulting in pestilence; or due to the nature of the area, as in Zaragoza, where digestion of diseases is difficult, and abscesses take a long time to heal by their very nature; or because there are one or more bones exposed within it.

E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	And now, let me explain how I perform the cure for fistula, which is done through surgical intervention with my hands.
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz. Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua. Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	If a large portion of the bone is affected by corruption and it has reached the marrow, then it is necessary to remove that part entirely by cutting right into where the corruption has spread; finally treat the wound until it heals.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio. And so I cut and incised over one of the openings which I had earlier noticed was near to the bone, and I found that part of it was corrupt: already earthy and rotten and blackened; and already a portion of the leg was corrupted because the matter had penetrated into the middle.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	And then I bound up what was revealed to me, that is the uncovered bone.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	I understood that the problem was not in the bone but only in that corruption which I had already cut away and bound up.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	And then I applied restorative medicine to the wound for a long time, but it did not heal.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And then I re-examined the area and found that there was further damage beyond what I initially discovered, revealing ongoing decay of the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	After carefully examining this area of decay, I attempted to treat and repair it but was unsuccessful in restoring its health.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	On the next occasion, I discovered it again and decided against cutting into the bone in a particular way or perforating for its repair; instead, I removed material from around an area of approximately one palm's width, extracting what appeared to be its marrow. Then, I treated this with medicine, which resulted in some consolidation and healing.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	No further surgery or cutting was necessary due to the arrangement of its veins and the patient's low tolerance and fear of death, as excessive evacuation caused fainting at all times.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	Thus, they are entirely healed and nothing remains in the place of hard bone tissue. Their arrangement within their body is beneficial and their virtue has returned to them; they have been restored to their former condition and can now walk without causing themselves harm or detriment in any way.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	Here is the translation of the first source sentence: 
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And place a stick or board under their bones appropriately, because when you do this, it is not forbidden for the saw to cut away the corrupted flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	Cover the area of corruption with the saw gradually, as if it is in the cavity of the bone and its corrosion does not appear upon inspection, force the saw to go deeper.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	If the bone is corrupted and not prominent, with one end continuing into the other, and the corrosion is in its middle or a part of it, then you must remove all flesh from every side; place a stick underneath, and saw that first part where the corrosion lies while ensuring the sawing continues onto the other part.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	The size of the saw must be according to the place of corrosion, as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	If the corrosion is in a joint, incise that corrupt joint, and saw through the bone where it continues into the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	If the corrosion is in the continuation of two joints, it is not a natural cause but an accident.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquella segon quascuna disposicio la cual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	Here is the translation of the provided text:

E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And its end is triangular with a sharp point.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian iron, seemingly covering all the causes we have mentioned regarding rays, incisions, and saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of extremity incision and bone perforation/piercing:

Here is the translation of the provided text:

The provided text describes medical procedures and symptoms in a medieval context, likely from a historical medical manuscript. Here is my best attempt at translating the first source sentence:
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly, if it is due to the corruption caused by some poisonous creatures such as the scorpion of the sea or viper and other similar ones.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or impact is at the tip of the finger, then you should cut open the finger and do not give space for the corruption to enter into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	Similarly, if it affects the hand, then you should cut open that area from the base of the forearm, and do not allow the corruption to reach the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	If instead of that, then you should cut open the arm up to the elbow at the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if the corruption spreads beyond that and surrounds the elbow, then at that point it becomes fatal for the patient; and to administer another cause of treatment other than this would be a waste of effort.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	Similarly, for the foot when corruption affects instead of the toe, then you should cut open that area up to one of the joints.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it reaches the instep of the foot, then you should cut open the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if you can go in from above, then make an incision in the thigh up to the hip joint.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already spread to the abdomen, there is no cure but dismissal; let the patient die.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	The method of incising a limb or performing an amputation is as follows: you should bind the ligament above and below where you wish to make the incision, with another binding on either side; extend your left hand down to the area below while extending your right hand up onto top; separate all flesh between both ligatures by splitting it apart until every piece of flesh has been exposed fully. Then proceed carefully towards cutting or sawing through this tissue.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And it is necessary to place linen cloths on all sides of the wound so that they do not touch any part of it directly; have these bindings applied tightly against the patient's injury and secure them firmly in order prevent infection from developing.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if there is bleeding during your operation, you should cauterize the affected area thoroughly or apply some blood-clotting powders to it before continuing with treatment until its completion.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then bind the injured limb firmly using appropriate dressings, take care of it until healing has been achieved.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I remind you of the case where an individual experienced this ailment in their foot, which resulted in the same incident we have discussed earlier, characterized by blackening of the skin on their foot due to severe burning akin to fire damage.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	This deterioration first manifests in their toe, gradually spreading across the entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	Subsequently, the afflicted individual prepares themselves for this procedure involving the extraction of pus from their affected limb, an act driven by their intense pain and burning sensation; they then make an incision on that foot near the joint, allowing the wound to heal.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	Over time, this same deterioration afflicts their index finger on the right hand.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then I step in to assist, applying the remedy on my collection of medicinal items onto their hand, aiming for a thorough cleansing of their body; however, the excess matter fails to disperse, leading it instead to their next finger which initiates on their palm.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	They request that I incise their hand, but I hesitate to do so due to concerns over the spreading of this excess matter; furthermore, I fear that any incision on their hand might prove fatal, given how deeply rooted this ailment appears to be.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And after he recovered from my treatment, he returned to his land and I was informed that this man prepared and cut open his entire hand, and was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	I have not added this narrative for any other reason but to be of assistance regarding what causes this disease and what is its meaning, according to which it should be treated.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	On the treatment of the bowels and the quality of enemas with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in any fleshy part of the body and it extends to such length that pus is formed within a cavity, then it breaks open and gets perforated, and pus comes out from it, leaving behind an empty space like that of a vessel, and the skin covering this area with fine linen cloth hasn't reached its final stage of corruption yet, nor has it affected any bone or nerve or ligament tissue beneath, such an abscess is called sinus and not fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	But if this space extends to the point where corruption has affected any tissue or member, then it is called a fistula and not a sinus.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	Its treatment is that you should cut away this entire skin as it has been folded over and especially when its under layer is delicate and made of cloth, so that it doesn't stick to the area due to corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	Here is my line-by-line translation of the provided text: 
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then you take what is necessary from him and dissolve it with water and honey; administer an enema to his lower bowel, tighten the orifice of it, and let the medicine remain in him for two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	Then remove it with an instrument; do this for as many days as are necessary to cleanse the bowel and diminish the putridity.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And sometimes an enema is administered with water and ashes when you do not have this medicine at hand; it's about you taking the ash of beech, putting it in water; then use that to administer an enema until you judge that the bowel has been cleansed.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient cannot tolerate Egyptian medicine or water and ashes, then administer an enema with water and honey mixed with very finely ground ginger, or an enema of wine and honey mixed together, because by nature honey cleanses and washes, and the wine makes [the bowel] adhere, especially when there is superfluous astringency and dryness in the wine.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you do this sometimes and judge that the bowel has been cleansed, then administer an enema with water that promotes flesh [growth].
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And if the opening is wide, then you gather its lips with a suture and leave enough space for the amount of the clyster to be inserted.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the opening from which the arm emerges is elevated towards higher parts, then cauterize it in the lowest place where the arm exits, because when the arm is constricted at its depth, flesh will form there.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to cauterize the sinus around the lowest area as desired, then make sure that you prepare the member with a preparation that allows the arm to exit more easily according to your ability and without any obstruction of the arm.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	Apply consolidating medicines over the sinus, suitable for what you aim to do, and place them on a linen cloth.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	Let the cloth be of such a large quantity that it covers the entire sinus opening; then, with scissors, cut into the right side of the sinus opening a slit slightly wider than the opening itself; next, spread over another linen cloth, intended for bandages, an amount equal to the size of this slit, and place it over the area far from the sinus opening so that arm movement is restricted and you do not have to remove the larger cloth until several days later.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	Now the one who is over the opening of the breastbone, you constantly massage it for what comes out on his arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And to know if what comes out of his arm is much or little, whether it's digested or undigested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And you consider the place of that breastbone, if the patient feels pain there or not, and whether it's infected.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your treatment is prolonged in this manner, and you see that the matter that is drawn over the opening of the breastbone has already formed a crust or an appropriate adhesion, then on the tenth day, you remove the dressing or scab, and when you remove the plaque, then change the cloth for another one and renew the ointment.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	Now if from the breastbone a very thin pus flows out of that space, then do not be disappointed with its adhesion because it is proper for his healing, since only some men have flesh generation in their scabs and others are healed by contrary means.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if from the breastbone many days have passed without any digested matter coming out of it, then you know that the wound hasn't adhered; and if the adhesion of the breastbone is delayed for a prolonged period, then adjust to medicines with drying properties, and if the medicines are humid in their substance but dry in virtue, such as *unguentum diachylon*, when there's excess moisture in it.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	Here is my attempt at translating the provided text into English: 
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel. De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione. 
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text into English: 
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	Under these circumstances, when you have what we've described in the previous section and your treatment is not successful, it is advisable to cut away with an iron tool all the superfluous tissue that remains from the nail, then cauterize the wound immediately afterwards because cauterization is very beneficial here.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	If the bone is intact and the nail is healthy but its additions have already compressed the flesh into separate parts, and it starts to puncture and hurt that tissue, then you should place a thin rod under the edge of the nail that pierces the flesh and push it in so as to cut away that flesh with ease, then put on whatever remains of the flesh some corrosive caustic medicines until everything is thoroughly rotted; and finally treat that area with ointments until it heals.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	If the corruption has already reached the bone, then you should cut away that part of the bone and remove it because no cure is possible when there is a corrupted bone present.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that the corruption and putrefaction have reached the finger, then cut it off at one of the joints depending on how much memory the patient has of it, and treat the wound until it heals.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla: This condition, which is born in the joints of some men, has very little flesh on it and is also very light in bones or claws.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them are born at the root of the joint or its origin is in certain of the said nuts (bones).
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	However, the one born in the nuts of the finger is not harmful, but this one that is born in the joints can be very painful.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And for those that are fleshy at birth, the incision is light, and it is with a broad knife that you must cut its root.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	However, for the one that is born at the root of the joint, the cure is difficult; therefore, beware of cutting it off.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And in the case of the one that is born on the finger at its nuts, you must first incise his flesh with a round incision around the bone, then saw it off with one of those saws suitable for this purpose, and then heal him so that he may recover.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	Here is my translation: 
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And then pause between their sheets and immerse them in rose-scented oil so that they are not lightly solidified, and separate them or place a thin lead sheet between them until it is properly solidified.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	Similarly, if solidification occurs in certain parts of the palm, then you must dry out that solidified area according to its preparation and make it conform to the shape of the limb.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Regarding incisions for veins, these are for varicose ones.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Veins are varicose veins and are thick, twisted vessels full of melancholic superfluities that come to the surface in various parts of the body; they appear more often on the legs, especially those who travel a lot or do manual labour.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Therefore, it is appropriate that you administer a purge of the black bile from the body through strong expulsion, and then bleed the patient from the basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	The healing of these veins can be done in two ways: one is that they are incised and the black blood is drawn out, and the other way is by raising the vein and extracting it entirely.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The translation of the first source sentence is as follows: 
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	Then bind him up, and command him to refrain from foods that produce black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	Repeat the cure through bloodletting when the veins are full, and note this down for the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	The elevation of their limbs should be done in this manner: if the patient has hair on their legs, shave it and then place them in a bath; immerse their leg in warm water until it reddens and the veins become prominent. Or, if you do not have a bath available, exercise the limb vigorously until it becomes scratched.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	Then tie a ligature around the vein in the right spot; it should be cut at its root or severed as low down as possible.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	Open the ligature with hooks and strip away all the surrounding tissue until you reach the vein; it should appear in your sight as something that droops towards blackness.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And when you release the ligature, you will see it turn white as if it were a cord.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	Then place it underneath that rail until it is elevated and free from the ligature; suspend it with a hook attached to a rope.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then cut another section close to that section with three incisions, and carefully remove the vein from its place where it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	Then lift that part and make an incision at the back of the section near the ankle, and carefully extract it and raise it out through the second section, and then remove it from the section above.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	Do this until you completely remove it from the section that is above or higher than all other sections, as everything has been exposed; then make an incision.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if you do not obey and remove it by lifting, then insert a strong, double-pointed needle and tie it, extract it, or insert your finger underneath and rotate your hand in all directions until it is released.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	Make sure it is not cut; for if it breaks, it will be difficult to lift the entire thing and cause harm to the patient.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And once everything is removed, place on the wound a cloth soaked in wine and oil, both rose-scented and not, and treat it until it is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.
