E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	Understood. I will continue translating the text into English line by line for you:
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	The form of the instrument which is dried animal gut.
Forma de unci orp:	Shape of an ounce-weight:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not like the needles nor is it of a sharp point so that it does not pierce the vein; and it is of flexible thickness, for if it were thin, it would cut into the vein due to its thinness; rather, it has superfluous thickness as we have mentioned.
De extraccio venae cruris.	On the extraction of the leg vein:
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is formed in the legs, in lowland areas such as Al-Ategi in Arabia and in the low and dry lands of India which are sparse with vegetation and have little grass.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And it is rarely formed in other parts of the body besides the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	Its formation is due to the process of putrefaction which arises from worms, snakes, and insects entering the body as venom, breeding within the putrid matter between the entrails and flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	A sign of the onset of this condition is an inflammation of the leg vein, and subsequently, the area becomes blistered; then the vein begins to emerge from the location of the blistering, appearing like a plant root.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	Certainly! Here is the translation of your provided text, line by line: 
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And as many times as you remove something from outside his body because of some cause, cover it with lead and pitch.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if it lasts a long time, then you make an incision in part of him and wrap the remainder; do not incise what has already come out since if you incise that [part] which is contracted and goes back inside the flesh, it will cause suppuration and putridity in the place as well as a bad ulcer.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	For this reason it should be treated continuously and extracted little by little until it is completely removed from behind him, without leaving any cause in his body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein there are some men for whom it is in its length of five and ten palms, and I have heard of one that measured twenty palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is incised at the time of its treatment, then insert a rod into his wound and perforate that with a long iron object going through to his body, until everything that is in the matter has been evacuated, and cause putrefaction of the place for some days by means of medicines; then treat that [wound] for the cure of suppurations.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein sometimes has many knots and lumps, especially when it appears at the joint of the foot or in the foot itself, and many openings appear on it, and each opening gives rise to a branch.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	Therefore, treat it as we have mentioned in the previous section and with what has been described above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Regarding the issue of worms generated under the skin, it is referred to as bovine disease or cattle sickness.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This illness is known as bovine sickness in some regions because it causes the patient to have many bumps on their body; it is a worm that is born between the skin and flesh, moving throughout the body and changing directions constantly until it breaks through the skin and emerges.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	Its generation is due to the putrefaction of certain bodily fluids, which can lead to the formation of worms, snakes, grubs, and other parasites in the abdomen.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	It is feared for its malicious nature; when it enters the body and reaches the head, it can burst open there, infecting and destroying the brain, which leads to the formation of many bumps.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	Therefore, when you want to cure and extract it, you must first observe its movement and appearance through touch, then firmly bind what is above and below with a tight bandage, dry it up, and finally remove it.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is embedded in the flesh and you cannot find it, then apply a hot iron to the area until it is destroyed; the main concern here, as previously mentioned, is its corruption of the affected part.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	But if you suspect that it has reached close to the brain, then bind firmly over the eyebrow; afterwards, cauterize and remove it. The patient must undergo a cleansing of their body with medicines that expel harmful, foul humors, and they should avoid food that causes decay.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	On surgery regarding the disease of the navel.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This disease is called 'nafir' in our region; it causes pain that moves from one body part to another.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	I have seen such cases as I am about to describe to you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then proceed to that painful area and press down on it with your hand; then wait here for one hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	Then move to the other body, stretching until you reach the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	Then he returned to me, rotating his body according to what I could see; and I was amazed by the speed of movement from one part of the body to another.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	I had previously seen this kind of thing in my patients according to that same manner, but I have witnessed many people who find pain relief through the movement from one body part to another.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	I did not see this in my female patients as I do with the men.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	I do not think this is the case but rather it could be because the woman was elderly, with dry skin and visible veins, which may have caused a different sensation when applying pressure.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	It is necessary to avoid this type of treatment for those with delicate skin and moist bodies, as their veins are more susceptible to damage.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	If you wish to continue the treatment despite the patient's pain, and it is not apparent on your skin as previously mentioned, then press down firmly but gently on the area until the sensation of movement has ceased, and then apply a cautery to the location.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	Certainly! Here is the translation of your provided text: 
De extraccio de sagetas.	De extraccio de sagetas translates to "On arrow extraction.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Sagetas (arrows) are diverse depending on the species and the parts of the body they target, as their diversity consists of those with large points, small ones, concave tips, blunt ends, solid bodies; and those with three edges, some with tongues, and others with barbs.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	The arrow, depending on the body part it hits, has two types of impacts: one is when vital organs are affected, such as the brain, heart, liver, lungs, kidneys, intestines, bladder, and similar; if upon striking any of these organs, you perceive signs of death, which I will explain below, then avoid extracting that arrow from them because it would cause their demise, which I'll detail further. When you do not see those ominous signs and the arrow is not deeply embedded in the organ, extract it and treat the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	The signs of the brain being struck by an arrow are: if it pierces through bone and comes out from above, causing intense headaches, blindness, vertigo, ringing in the ears, inflammation, and redness on the tongue, spasms, mixed-up reasoning, vomiting bile, having a hard time speaking, losing their voice. White discharge resembling dust emerges from around the wound, along with watery fluids coming from the flesh itself.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And so if these signs appear to you, then refrain from the cure and extraction of the arrow unless it is necessary.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	But the signs of an arrow in the heart are when it is close to the left nipple, and you feel that it has lodged in hard tissue, not soft; and also if the movement of the arrow resembles the pulse, and black blood flows out, with coldness in the extremities, a weak pulse, and fainting; and so you should know that death descends swiftly soon after.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs when an arrow has pierced the lung are a great outflow of frothy blood, and the vessels near the neck become inflamed, the patient's complexion changes, they exhale heavily, and crave cold air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	If the arrow grazes the membrane that is near the foot, and the pain is close to the little toes, it causes a great swelling with intense pain and sighing, but not all of the muscles in the limbs are affected.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if an arrow strikes the stomach, then often some undigested food will be vomited.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if the arrow is lodged in the abdomen and cannot be removed through incision or by drawing it out with a ligature (i.e., by pulling on it), then make an opening into the wound, or the hernia or intestine that has been ruptured so that there is no hope of extracting the arrow.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the arrow penetrates into and perforates the bladder causing urine to be discharged through it (the wound) or some other part of the body exterior to the bladder, and possibly there is pain in the patient, then know that this situation is fatal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	All other body parts such as the face, neck, throat, shoulders, vertebrae of the back, breast bone, hip, leg and similar limbs are salvageable according to medical experts' opinions if the arrow does not penetrate a vein or artery nor is it poison-tipped.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I recount this to you regarding what I know about the nature of these arrows so that you can understand their treatment.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	The reason is this: once I extracted an arrow from one man's eye socket at the root of his nose and created a new opening behind his ear; he was healed without further injury to the eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And so the Judge is seated, and may no evil befall him.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	I extracted another arrow from a Christian man's throat, which was an Arab arrow and had pierced his ear. I made an incision between the two jawbones, as it was already submerged in his throat. Then, with skill, I pulled it out, and the Christian was healed.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	I extracted another arrow from a man's belly, thinking he would die from it. Since thirty days had passed and there was no change in his condition or bowels, I made an incision near the arrow and applied a remedy to it. He was healed, and no evil befell him.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	I saw a man with an arrow lodged in his back, and the wound had become infected, for it had been there for seven years. I removed the arrow from the base of his hip.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	I saw a woman with an arrow in her belly; the wound was infected and had not healed despite her regular bodily functions remaining unchanged, and she suffered no harm during any of her natural processes.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And I saw another man whom an arrow had struck in the face, and the wound had healed, but the arrow remained inside, causing no pain or any symptoms like this.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	I extracted the arrow from the man, one of the princes of the king who had been struck in the middle of his nose and it had slightly bent to the right, while remaining completely hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	I was called upon to treat him, exactly three days after the arrow had struck.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	Then I carefully examined the wound left by the arrow, which was very narrow; and then I inquired about any subtle sensation he might feel, but he did not notice anything; however, he felt a prickling sensation beneath his right ear, so I assumed that this must be caused by the tip of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	I applied an ointment made of attractive and digestive herbs to the area, hoping that it would become infected so that I could locate the arrow's position by its dryness.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	But I did not find any significant mark indicating that the arrow had reached this spot; and so, I continued to apply the ointment for many days without any effect; meanwhile, the wound healed completely and the patient stopped complaining about the pricking sensation in his face over several days until one day he felt the arrow inside his nose and informed me of it.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	Here is the translation of your first source sentence: 
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	Here is the translation of your first source sentence: 
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	Here is the translation of the provided source sentence: 
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	Here is the translation of your provided text: 
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	Here is the translation of your provided text: 
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And so, I say that arrows are not expelled from the body parts they have pierced but rather through two methods: either by the attraction of the place where it has entered or by the opposite action in another part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	The arrow that is expelled by the entrance wound, whether it has penetrated into flesh or not, must be drawn and extracted.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	If you do not observe the time of its removal and extract it too early, then it is better that you leave it for a few days until the flesh around it putrefies and the attraction to it lessens along with its exit.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	Similarly, if it is embedded in bone and you do not observe the time of its removal, then leave it for a few days and repeat the process of attraction and motion every day until it can be extracted.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	If you do not observe the time and leave it for several days, then it is necessary that you drill into the circuit of the arrow in that bone from every side with a fine borer until the space is widened by the arrow, and then extract it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	If the arrow is embedded in the bone of the head and has pierced into one of the ventricles of the brain, and the patient experiences any of the accidents I have mentioned, then refrain from extracting the arrow and leave it until its presence becomes equalized over several days; for if the arrow reaches the medulla, then death will not be protracted.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	Here is the translation of your first source sentence: 
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	Here is the translation of your provided text:
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquella am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if his ears are the ones that are affected, then you must free the flesh in which it is embedded from all sides with all the skill you can muster; and devise some means of accomplishing this without tearing the flesh either at the point where the ear is broken or where it has been twisted so as not to cause further injury.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	When you proceed to extract the arrow from any place it may be lodged, use all your force with pincers or pliers on all sides so that it yields; and act with great care lest the arrow break and render both its withdrawal and extraction more difficult for you.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you are unable to accomplish this immediately, then leave the patient for a few days until the tissues in its vicinity have recovered; and then repeat your attempt when the pain has been alleviated.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	But if you find that the flow of blood opposes you, then proceed as we have said regarding cure in its chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	Guard against any unnecessary incision of the vein, nerve, or cord, and devise every possible means for avoiding the arrow's withdrawal; do this with ease, calmness, slowness, and firmness, as I have described to you.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And therefore, make the arrow [or lance] lie across him in such a way that the patient is positioned according to the figure indicating where you should place the arrowhead on them, for this is more beneficial.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	If that is not possible for you, then do what is feasible according to the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	But if the arrows are sticking out beyond the opposite side of the other limb, or you have already proceeded with any incision on the limbs that are outside [the body], or there is any gaping wound at the extremity of the arrow due to the felt movement from the broken end and sometimes it becomes prominent; then you must cut into that area; and let the section be according to the amount that can be grasped by the forceps; and then remove said object, for it has been loosened a little so as to facilitate its extraction.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	If it is retained in the bone, then you must cut around its circumference until the arrow presses against the bone, and widen that area to insert your instruments; and then extract said object.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	Otherwise, leave it for a few days, and then repeat the process when you remove it.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	And if the shaft of the arrow is protruding from there, then push it in with your hands.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	If the arrow shaft has fallen out and you need to administer an impulse, insert a concave instrument into the wound if it is blocked, then push that instrument along with the shaft.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	If the arrow is concave, push it with a strong instrument going into its cavity because the instrument eases the arrow.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrow is poisoned, be sure that you scoop out all the flesh around its entry wound, if it's possible for you to do so, and then treat the wound with something appropriate.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the arrow penetrates into a leg, or belly, or bladder, or side of the body and is accessible so that you can reach it with your hand or a rod, and it's possible for you to extract it in this way then do so while taking care not to cut any veins or nerves. Then stitch up the wound if required, and treat the injury until healing takes place.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Form of forceps by which arrows are extracted:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	Their tips are like the beak of a bird, made with a serrated edge when they grasp the arrow so that it doesn't escape.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquella sorda:

De fleubotomia de las venas.	De fleubotomia de las venas." 
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua. Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps. Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The relief of veins that are just behind the ears is for ancient cataract, emigration and saffatis and old ulcers.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	And the process of bleeding those veins is as follows: first, shave the patient's head and rub their head vigorously in the area where both veins are located; then have the patient stretch their neck with a bandage around it, so that the two veins appear, they are situated near the ears at two vulnerable parts of the head. And feel for those veins with your finger, if you can detect them pulsing under your finger, this is the place.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Then take the lancet, which is sharp and cutting, and insert it beneath the vein so that the phlebotomist can gain access to it.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	And raise your hand holding the vein and lancet upwards, separating them slightly and make an incision with the sharp lancet.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	Let the length of the incision be approximately two fingers in size, or around that amount, and allow as much blood to flow out as you wish.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then apply some powder and leave it be until it is healed.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	Certainly! Here is a translation of your provided text line by line into English:

Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	Forma de fleubotomi mirti:
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	Keep his hips like this with supports, and proceed to open the concave veins that are full, appear thick, and contain dark clotted blood.
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	And this is how you perform phlebotomy on an olive tree:
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	This phlebotomy is of lesser width and has a more delicate end, suitable for the thin veins that contain citrus-like, refined blood.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre. E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	And it is necessary for the phlebotomist, when performing this phlebotomy, to be careful and cautious in their work as there lies an artery nearby; if they were to make a mistake and adjust their incision during phlebotomy, they would cut into that very artery causing blood to flow out, thus one must not perform this phlebotomy with a sharp instrument but rather by cutting with a knife.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit. Here is the translation of the provided source sentence: 
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you see that, upon tying the ligament, there is inflammation in the place you have marked with a tent, then this inflammation is an arterial inflammation, and thus avoid it.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if you see the blood flowing during phlebotomy like the urine of a child, and it is thin and red, then know that this is arterial blood; and in such case, hold and place your finger on it for a long time; then remove your finger, and if the blood is cut off, as many times it is, then you bind the arm and leave it.
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	Watch the patient's mucus, as it may indicate their fear, but do not cause them harm for a few days until they are healed.
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	But if the blood is not cut off and you see that there is no other medical option available, then proceed to cut into the artery, especially when its extremity contracts and blood stops flowing; or else take some fistic scurf and apply it, taking half of it and binding it on the vein's location with tight straps and powder for another day.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc. Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	Here is my translation of the provided text:

Here is the translation of the first source sentence: 
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is situated between two nerves, then you must open it lengthwise.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The purpose of venesection or bleeding of the cephalic vein is to draw blood from the head and benefit patients suffering from head ailments.
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	And when doing this specifically, if you want to perform venesection with an olive lancet or a myrtle lancet; for it is the safest of all veins, as it lies away from any artery and nerve.
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	However, it is essential for you to consider when performing venesection that you should not strike the head of the lacertus alone; instead, search for a more gentle spot and do not hit too hard, especially if it is the first time attempting venesection on someone.
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	But sometimes, an abscess may form in some individuals when they are not bled during the first strike of venesection; you should never hit that abscess again.
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	The quality of venesection and its outcomes depend on various factors that require consideration for correction.
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first factor is understanding that venesection should be administered for the preservation of health and as a preventive measure against diseases; it should be performed on one of the veins in the arm: cephalic, basilic, or median cubital vein; preferably at the beginning of spring, before meals in spring and autumn, and during winter after eating, when signs of fullness appear.
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	And a bloodletting should be performed on the third day or when three hours have passed since daylight.
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	Bloodletting can be administered whenever it is deemed appropriate and necessary, whether during the night or day, at any hour and in all circumstances.
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	A child should not undergo bloodletting before the age of 14 years old. A pregnant woman should only be bled between her fourth and seventh month of pregnancy. The elderly who have passed their 60th year should avoid it altogether.
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	If someone wants to undergo bloodletting for any reason, it is essential that they first cleanse their intestines with a strong laxative if there is any retained waste or injury present in the bowels. This ensures that excess matter does not drain into the bloodstream during the procedure and damage vital organs.
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	Patients suffering from nausea and hangovers, or those recovering from illness or drunkenness should not undergo bloodletting until they have completely recovered as it may worsen their condition. Individuals with dropsy are also advised against this procedure. Furthermore, bloodletting is contraindicated in cases where the patient experiences severe abdominal pain, vomiting, diarrhea, or any other circumstance that depletes bodily strength and energy, whether due to physical exertion, animalistic urges, or spiritual practices such as fasting or staying awake for extended periods of time.
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	Then consider the elevation of humors; if their blood is thick, give them food and drink, and medicine if it suits their condition.
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	Then enter the bath if nothing prevents it, or engage in some exercise to thin out their blood.
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	Apply the phlebotomy to them on their foot during the day, around about third hour, as we have said.
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	Ensure that the patient's foot is protected on that day from all harmful animal encounters, such as distress, anger, fear, and any physical accidents like work-related strain or unnecessary hardships.
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	Have the patient's bed surrounded by things that are customarily used for their pleasant aroma and scent, like herbs, ointments, and other similar items, depending on what is available.
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	Let the phlebotomist sit upon a cushion that is higher than the one on which the patient needs to be bled.
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	Then pull out their arm, and the phlebotomist should grasp it with his hand two or three times; then bind him tightly with a leather strap and wrap it around twice.
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	Here is my best guess at translating the provided text: 
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	And then, when applying pressure, ensure that the person who is to undergo bloodletting should press their hands together between them until the veins become engorged and visible to the touch.
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	And then, the bloodletter should grease his bloodletting instrument with a little old oil; and then place two fingers of his left hand on that vein, over the spot where he intends to perform the venesection, so that the vein may be slightly distended, and the percussion thereby checked. For that is the vein which beats like a cord as it contains air, and on being punctured yields blood. And of these veins that are full of wind, when you place your instrument upon one that is contracted, then yield to the instrument; and do not open the vein if it is narrow.
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	And therefore, for this reason, it is necessary that the bloodletter should be firm and careful in all these cases.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	Then withdraw the bloodletting instrument, but if the vein has been opened in one spot, then it is so; otherwise, repeat this procedure elsewhere near that place or a little above it, with haste, unless the area is swollen.
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	And then repeat the bloodletting if she desires.
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	And if the aperture is small and blood flows gently, and you fear that it may not reach the desired quantity, then repeat the phlebotomy at another point near the first one with a slight adjustment in position, and do this quickly before the site becomes inflamed. For when the site becomes inflamed in many men, only a shallow incision should be made.
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	But if you see that the site is already inflamed, do not repeat the procedure on it, for this offers no benefit to you; instead, place some oil-soaked cloth over it, as this will soothe and cool down the blood.
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	And among all oils, this particular one is best suited for this location.
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	Similarly, apply oil-soaked cloth to all bloodletting procedures where there is a risk of blood coagulation, and do so with an ointment made from myrrh and sagapenum when it has been placed on the wound for some time, as this will thin out the blood and prevent its clotting.
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	And if a large inflammation develops at the bloodletting site, which often happens, especially to those who have not been bled previously or when only a small incision has been made into the vein, then apply a dressing and place over it a sponge soaked in warm water and salt, slightly heated, and leave this on for an hour as it will help dissolve any swelling.
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	And now it is necessary to extract the excrement from that vein with its complement, or from another vein.
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	And if there remains in the place for a few days any blackness or greenness, do not take note of it; and if you wish, apply to that some mixture of aloe and dissolved myrrh, or some mixture of mastic tree juice or galbanum or something similar.
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	And if at times abscesses and swellings happen, you must do phlebotomy of the basilic vein.
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	Then place your hand on it, and if you find softness there, then increase the pressure of your hand over that area, as that swelling is evil and harmful; and in this case, be careful not to apply any of the mixtures mentioned before, for blood will flow violently from the artery.
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And make a poultice with something that has astringency, so the area hardens, and then cure it with another remedy until it is healed.
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	And you must extract blood from every person according to the quantity of their vigor, and also according to the hue that predominates in the blood depending on how it looks.
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	If the blood is black, let it flow until it turns red; if you see it thick, let it flow until it becomes thin; and if it is sharp (thin), let it flow until its sharpness is removed.
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat.	For someone who is full and strong and needs bloodletting, the phlebotomy of the vein should be increased, and let the phlebotomist be wide.
E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.	For someone who is frail, the opposite should be done, and it is necessary to extract blood in small doses, and let the incision be narrow.
E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	The best way to perform phlebotomy of the vein is with a transverse section, not a puncture.
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	This method of phlebotomy is safer from the flow of blood and the incision of nerves, and it is more commendable and safer than phlebotomy according to latitude and longitude.
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.	For those who usually experience fainting during phlebotomy, you must perform the phlebotomy, and it is necessary that you cure them beforehand with a piece of bread infused in wine from millet or simple oxymel scraped; and extract some blood from them in three or four sessions.
E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.	And if there is a cooling of the complexion, then take flebotomy [bloodletting] to infuse with a syrup of myrrh or an aromatic syrup of honey flavored with spices such as pepper, cinnamon, ginger and similar things, or an aromatic and very fragrant syrup.
E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.	And if syncope occurs and it is due to the loss of a lot of blood, then you must take flebotomy [bloodletting], and drink water from animal hide and very fragrant syrup; use aromatic aloe vera and wrap their feet with it.
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	And use the other causes we mentioned in the chapter on syncope due to evacuation.
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	And for those who want to revive their arms and dissolve their blood again, it is appropriate for him whom the flebotomy [bloodletting] was performed due to evacuation, and his nature is cold, that he evacuates blood little by little, as long as it's according to the amount of virtue in continuous days.
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	But for those who want to revive their arms and restore their blood a second time, and their body is strong, then they should do it about seven or nine hours after the first bloodletting.
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	If one wishes to draw out blood from their body and move it away from the affected part towards another location, it is best to do so on the second or third day.
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	When a body with excessive and thickened blood develops a fever, it is necessary to extract blood from them in one session, taking out a large quantity, and repeating this process frequently until the patient faints; since you have preserved all the conditions for a phlebotomy, and you must keep your hand on their pulse to prevent death due to faint, as many times this happens when the phlebotomist is ignorant and negligent.
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	And it is not necessary when you want to loosen the arm and evacuate the blood for a second time, even though the opening of the vein has already closed and it becomes difficult to extract blood, that you press on it with vehemence or bend it excessively, as this is very harmful.
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	Leave it be until you can perform the phlebotomy again; or if this is due to the sharpness of your instrument that has caused blood to clot at the opening of the vein; or place on it a poultice made with alfarva or sage, and apply light compression so that blood may flow out.
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	And if the vein is infected, then leave it alone and do not touch it until the infection has subsided.
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.	And if it is necessary to drain the blood gradually, and there is no other option, then you may bleed him on that spot or on the other arm in another vein.
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	The vein known as the 'rope of the arm' is to be bled in the place of the cephalic or basilic veins when they are not found or are hidden, as it is composed of those.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	The quality of the bloodletting for the patient is that they should immerse their hand in cold water until the cup turns red and the vein becomes visible.
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	And then apply a light but firm pressure over that hand gently squeezing it; and then draw blood according to the small transverse line, not laterally nor along its length.
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	Whether the opening is wide or your bloodletting causes it to widen, you should bleed that patient just above the wrist joint a little.
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	And if the flow of blood is obstructed, then you should immerse your hand in cold water again and let the blood run into the water until you have achieved what is necessary.
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And the phlebotomy of this vein is safer than all other veins because there are no pulsating veins or nerves underneath.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And the phlebotomy of the right arm is appropriate for treating liver ailments.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	The procedure for phlebotomy is as follows: you should tighten the hand lightly with your own or with a ligature, because you have to immerse it in warm water beforehand until the vein becomes engorged and clearly visible at the puncture site; then you make an oblique incision there; if you cut too deep you will not harm anything vital.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	Remember not to press your hand on the phlebotomy site because underneath there are only nerves stripped of their flesh.
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	Then immerse your hand in warm water again and let the blood flow into it, for if you don't re-immerse it in warm water, the blood will clot at the opening of the vein and its flow is blocked.
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	And when you have drawn the required amount of blood, then apply oil and salt to the vein so that it does not stick together again; similarly, be sure to do this for all branches.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquella de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de the melsa.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And when performing phlebotomy on him, do it in the same way as you did with the other one.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	The use of the cephalic vein for bloodletting is suitable for illnesses that occur in the lower part of the body, such as diseases affecting the genitals, and also for retention of menstrual fluids, diseases of the lungs, and similar ailments related to long-standing ulcers on the thighs or legs.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	The procedure for bloodletting involves placing his foot in warm water and gently massaging it until the veins become visible; then secure the foot at the joint with a strap; identify the vein's location on the inside of the ankle, just above the big toe, where it branches out across the sole of the foot.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	Therefore, perform the bloodletting on the largest branch of the vein below the leg near the ankle, as it is better and more wholesome.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	And if you are bloodletting from the vein on the sole of the foot, be careful to avoid damaging any nerves that lie beneath it on the surface of the foot; place your bloodletting instrument across the vein, as if you were intending to make an incision.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And let the bloodletting begin.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	However, if the issuing of blood is forbidden; then submerge the patient's foot in warm water and let the blood flow out until it has been evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the bloodletter makes a mistake during the first attempt, then reapply the bloodletting to a different spot nearby, as this area is salty (possibly referring to salt deposits or minerals); do not fear causing harm but be cautious of nerves, as we have mentioned before.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	Similarly, proceed with the other foot in the same manner.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And for the sciatic vein, as we have mentioned, its location is at the back of the calf below the wildwood joint.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	The benefit of bloodletting for this patient is to alleviate hip pain when it comes to black bile (one of the four humors in medieval medicine).
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the quality of this bloodletting procedure is that the patient should enter a bath, and then tie their thigh with haste and strength using a piece of fabric from the left side of their waist to just above the calf on four fingers of its length; it will not appear anywhere else.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquella segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas quella per inscizio o secces quella per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	Here is the translation of the sentence: 
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And be cautious of the nerves, and let the desired amount of blood flow.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	Then untie the bandage and place a cotton pad over the bloodletting site, and secure it lightly as this will heal quickly.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	On cupping therapy and the qualities of its use.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Cupping glasses can be made from horn, or earthenware, or glass.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	Cupping therapy is performed in two ways: one involves making incisions and drawing blood, while the other is cupping without incision.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this cupping therapy without incision is done in two ways: one with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	There are fourteen places on the body where cupping therapy with incision and blood drawing is administered, and these areas are as follows: one place at the nape of the neck, which is at the back of the head; another spot midway between two parts of the spine in the back; a location under the jaw just below the mouth; points on both sides of the cheekbone; an area near the end of the tailbone; places on either side of the armpit; spots on both forearms; areas on each wrist; and sites on both calves.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	Here is my translation of the first source sentence: 
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	If it is necessary to induce vomiting due to illness or continuous need, administer it at any time: at the beginning of the month, at its end, and anytime in between.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	Which is caused by when men are in whom the blood becomes too dense due to excessive extraction through vomiting and thus heaviness and fullness; it is found that they have swelling and redness on their face and head, and on their neck; they also have eruptions on their faces and foreheads, darkness, and dullness around their eyes; those who vomit excessively often feel an emptiness in their stomachs; there are those whose laughter increases; there are others with a taste of blood in their mouths or a blood-stained tongue when they spit; some experience increased sleepiness; others see blood, swelling, worms, sores and other similar symptoms in their dreams.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And therefore, when you encounter any of these symptoms and specifically if it is during the third or middle part of the month, we command that vomiting should be induced as long as two to three days have passed.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	The benefit of vomiting from the nape is that when it brings relief to the head and what has settled in the eyes; this should be followed by the evacuation of all the body's excess.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this window is located in the area of venesection for the cephalic vein.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	It is not advisable to use it on someone with a dark complexion or who has a cold, as it can cause great harm.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And for this reason, it is not suitable to use it on the elderly or on those whose heads are affected by cold diseases.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	There is a risk that the person who continues to be exposed to it will forget everything; thus, you should instruct the window operator to remove their hand slightly from the cup in those places, fearing the generation of forgetfulness.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	Cupping with alkahest is performed in the venesection area of the femoral vein and the basilic vein; this leads to asthma, constriction of the airways, tearing of the air tube, coughing, and congestion.
