E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	The alkahest cup should be slightly lifted, for if it is left in place, it causes weakness in the heart and stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	Cupping with alhagdahan results in accidental headaches and ophthalmia, hemicrania, proptosis, toothache pain at the roots of teeth; it is done in the venesection area of the basilica.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And now you must instruct the cupper not to press his hand upon the scarification so that he may not gash an artery and cause a flow of blood.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And the cupping that you make below the chin will give him alcohol in his mouth and corrupt his gums; also it will disfigure his face like the diseases that are in the mouth, and they take the place of bloodletting upon both lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	But the cupping that is done upon two paddles will give him headache, which arises from excess of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And the cupping of two parts inside the hollows of the arms will give him the benefit of bloodletting from three veins; that is, the basilic, the median cubital and cephalic vein, for it draws forth the blood from all those small veins in the flesh to the larger ones which flow into these three.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And order the cupper not to proceed with scarification if the place is bared of flesh and only nerves and arteries are left.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	It is a dry cup which you apply upon the buttocks, and it will give him piles in his fundament as well as deeper ulcers below.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, they weaken the entire body and cause fainting in many men.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	For cupping, the attachment should be suitable for placing cups on both legs.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	The quality of the cupping position is that you place the cup at the beginning on an empty stomach and draw out (the humor) with a light suction, and do not prolong the position of the cups, but remove them lightly, and repeat this several times, so that the humors come to the surface in equal measure.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease to repeat this process, continuing until you see the area turn red and swell up, and that the color of blood appears.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	Then you make incisions and repeat the suction little by little, and consider the body's position.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	For this man who has tender flesh with few pores, it is sufficient that you make incisions once and not more, so that the area does not become ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And instruct the cupper to widen the incisions and deepen them slightly, and facilitate the suction with ease.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if the blood is thickened, then you should make two incisions, for in the first incision, the path of purification is opened for the blood and its moisture.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	May it be that in the second, there is an examination achieved through the extraction of thick blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is very turbid or cloudy, then make a third incision to reach the deepest part.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	Finally, when we wish to extract blood little by little or in small amounts, one incision is sufficient for us.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want to extract a large quantity of blood, then we make multiple incisions; but if we know the blood is thick, it is necessary to make deep incisions.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	The limit of an incision is only the depth of the cut made.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	If the skin of the patient is thick, hard, dark-colored, and their pores are narrow, then the places for cupping should be lubricated with gentle, open, and resolving oils; if it is summer time, use aloe vera oil, violet oil, or oil from bitter almonds; but in winter, narcissus oil, lily oil, chamomile oil, or blood-derived substances, as well as similar ones.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	Here is my line-by-line translation of the provided text: 
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquellas.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And for someone whose blood is of a very moist temperament, wash their belly with sour wine, or water from myrtle and sumac, as well as things similar to these.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And for someone whose superfluities are thick, wash their belly with old wine, or water from savory (majoram), which is majorana, or a decoction of dill, or chamomile, and things similar to these.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	Ensure that the washing is done before the bath; take care to administer it immediately after the bath for an hour or two and ensure they rest after.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is it that should be regulated while washing someone who has been bled before the washing?
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	Take into account at the beginning: if the washer or the person who is to be bled is choleric and has sharp blood and inflammation, then take cooling agents like vinegar made of mustard seeds, endive in sour wine and lettuce, rocket (arugula), and drinks similar to these.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And serve them dishes such as chicken, and meat of birds that are fat, and food seasoned with acids like vinegar, lemon juice or sour wine, and things similar to these.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And on days of venesection (bloodletting) and phlebotomy, it is necessary for them to drink more than eat.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And it is advisable to give some men a drink of theriac (a medicinal compound), or a muscle medication if it has been musk-flavored, or at least an alcelita before venesection or phlebotomy, so that their main limbs are comforted and the blood is made thinner; and they should not be given any food then.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	But the vents which are scars must be placed on the liver, and over the knee and gout, and on the navel, in places below the joint of the hip bone, since these members do not suffer scarring.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not intended for that kind of bloodletting from the limbs rather than attraction of blood from members, so I place a ventouse on the nipple in disease of hemorrhage of blood from nose; and we use this to dissolve cold viscosity encrusted onto the limb, so I place it on the abdomen and navel; since this rarefies the limb and scalds it and removes pain which resolves viscosity.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And it has already been placed on tumors when they occur in their opacity or pox, since by virtue of its strong attraction the male tumor and eradicates the female pus from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And similarly, when you place it over the liver and spleen area, you must beware of gas buildup in those areas.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	These cupping procedures are administered to the patient using suction only; sometimes, they are done with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And at other times, they are performed on the spleen illnesses with cups filled with warm water.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	This is why the cup should be filled and made bigger; it's just water or water with herbs cut into it appropriately.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Procedure for cupping with fire: make the hole of the size of two fingers; and fill it to a third of a palm in height; put it on their side, near their spine; the opening should be small enough so that only a needle can fit through.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	It should be made of horn or citrus wood with large edges; make it lion-colored, equal and smooth, so that it doesn't hurt the body part when you place it on top.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And in the middle of it there should be a crossbar made of horn or iron where you place the candle with fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And this wound is much larger than the one we previously discussed, and its size depends on the severity of the illness and the age of the patient.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	The cups for children and weak individuals should be different from the cups used for young adults or those with robust bodies.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	The process of applying this cup with heat to the affected limb involves placing a small amount of decently dry kindling in front of a small wax candle; then, place it over the center of the transverse bar at the center of the cup so that the fire is lit below and does not burn the patient's body.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	Once it is placed on the patient's limb and your finger is over the opening we mentioned earlier, when we have cups ready but do not want to lift a finger or let steam escape from that opening, then the cup will gradually cool down.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	Then you adjust the mechanism in the way that suits you best; repeat this step as many times as necessary.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	In the case of a cup used for treating pleurisy with water, there is no need for a transverse bar or opening; it is simply filled with water and placed directly on the affected limb.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is its structure: The larger the bellows, the better, as it can receive a great quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter 97.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Leeches are not administered to many body parts but only those where cupping is impossible due to their small size, like the palm and gums and similar areas; or on a part devoid of flesh, such as the finger and nose and their likes.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	The quality of the leeches you find matters; they should be from clean stagnant waters.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	Then let them stay in stagnant water day and night before using them, ensuring their stomachs are empty; and first evacuate the patient's body with bloodletting and cupping; then massage the affected part until it reddens; and finally place the leeches on them.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are full, take them off.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	If cupping of the area is feasible, it will be more beneficial afterwards.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	Otherwise, wash the area with vinegar and then with warm water; massage it and wring [dry] it.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And now, if it is necessary, proceed with a second round of bloodletting, as long as there are spots that can be changed.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the use of leeches is prohibited due to suspension or unavailability, then rub the area with fresh blood [from another source] or insert a needle into these places until blood flows; and then place them [the needles], for they will increase as soon as they sense any blood.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to cough, sprinkle a little powdered aloe over them, or salt, or ashes, and they will soon cough.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the third part of the treatment: restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very important in the art of medicine, and it concerns the restoration of fractures and accidental dislocations of bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, my son, beware that this chapter is scoffed at by foolish doctors and the uneducated masses; those who have never given any time to studying the books of ancient scholars nor read a single letter from them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason, the knowledge of these techniques is scarce in our land; I have not forgotten what I've learned at any time, and I have only added to my understanding through lengthy reading of ancient texts and deep study of their wisdom.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And then I devoted my entire life to experimentation and study.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	I have already described in this chapter everything that my science entails and all that I have personally experimented with; since I have briefly summarized this for you, saving you from lengthy detail; I have condensed it at the end of this summary; and I have shown this at the end of my declaration; and I have designed within these notes on the forms of instruments administered in this process, as is done through the addition of my declaration, just as I did in two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	Chapter One.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	A summary and collection of information regarding bone fractures, which is essential to understand before we begin the remembrance of fractured body parts and their various characteristics.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, let us state in the prologue of this chapter the main points of our discussion; and these chapters are intended for the understanding of those who wish to become practitioners and wish to be certain about the veracity of their knowledge; I am addressing you, and you are those who are eager to learn or already know this noble art.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And so I say that when you encounter a bone fracture, dislocation, sprain, or bruise, it is necessary for you to begin with phlebotomy or bloodletting, or any combination thereof, unless some cause prohibits it, such as weakness of the patient's constitution, or if the individual who has suffered this injury is a child, or an elderly person in poor health, or during times of extreme heat or cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to their usual routine, with which they are accustomed to functioning.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And as the broken bone begins to heal, it is advisable that the patient be fed with nutritious food of high fat and heavy content, such as wheat porridge cooked with water, rice, capons, feet, cows' stomachs, eggs, fresh fish, and similar fatty foods. With this diet, fracture coagulation occurs more lightly and better.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	Know that broken bones in men who are either in their first age or elderly cannot be fully repaired and consolidated as nature intended due to the drying out of their limbs.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	They are consolidated and continued as natural throughout the drying of those limbs; also, they are continued and consolidated in their softness, like the bones of young children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	However, nature provides an adjustment and a bandage for the broken bone from any part of the body in a way similar to glue, which is a thickness that adheres and strengthens what has been joined together and tied up; until it reaches its end of strength and firmness, like fire at the beginning, without any cause prohibiting its work.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	For this reason, it is necessary that you place the patient's food in such a way that they are heavy and have viscosity and thickness; as we said before.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	There is a different kind of fracture depending on the type of limb.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the types of fractures vary depending on the diversity of limbs, as a fracture in the tibia is different from one in the skull; and similarly, a fracture in the foot bone differs from one in the spine; and likewise, all other members are diverse among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I want a recollection of every type of fracture, laid out in its own separate chapter.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	There is also diversity within each type of fracture itself.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	These fractures are further diversified within themselves; for example, there is the curved fracture and that which occurs in its stars; and some occur lengthwise throughout the bone: such as stagia, astelhas, addicios (both proceeding and not), also when a quill is ready to write, disruption and plagues of the head, and small fissures.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And this instrument or tool is specifically designed for the restoration of the patient, as will be explained later regarding its unique usage in different areas.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Signs of bone fracture include:
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And this is how a bone fracture is recognized: it shows as deformity and protrusion of the broken part with appearance of prominence when touched; or simply by feeling it when you compress that area using your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And if there is no visible deformity in the affected area and you do not feel great pain when you move your bone while touching it, then there is no fracture here.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	It is possible that there could be a deformity or small fracture, in which case you should not press it with your hand and compress it completely; instead, place on it some of the medicines which will be mentioned later specifically for this moment; and then bandage it tightly but carefully.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And know that when the affected area is curved and not divided into two or another part of it has not been cut off, like if its entire piece had not been separated completely, then you must start from now onwards to rectify it before it happens to be infected with an abscess.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if the patient has an abscess, let it be left for a few days until the abscess subsides; then treat them according to whatever method you see fit with lightness and ingenuity.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	Know that the restoration of the patient's health, their recovery, is easier than dealing with any setback or deterioration.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	Then strengthen them according to the upcoming recollection of their health, considering it as something that will return.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if the fracture in the bone is severe, then it becomes necessary to extend this broken limb by two parts, whether it's an arm or a leg; use your hand if the limb is small; or use two ropes or one rope and your hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And ensure that you place the limb in a position where it aligns with its natural shape and form while keeping the separated parts of the broken limb extended, after which you must make these additions return to their places using ingenuity and whatever method you can.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	Be mindful of your strength so that you do not cause pain or injury to the patient through your surgical operation; and ensure, as much as it is within your power, that you bring one bone together with its companion in their best possible forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And now it is necessary that you touch him with your hand at this moment, and if you see any different cause here, correct it and adjust it according to the amount of your virtue.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	Avoid excessive extension and compression, just as foolish doctors who perform many surgeries cause post-operative abscesses or cause contraction in the limb, which we have seen through their inept operations.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	Then connect and perform an accurate and gentle operation on that limb, and provide rest and tranquility; advise the patient about this and instruct them to avoid any movements that may harm the limb during their wakefulness or sleep, watch for any reactions and agitation from them, as well as any excretions, and you must supervise all of their actions with your full strength; wait until the positioning of the limb is such that it ensures pain relief, which occurs when one feels pain or injury in a certain position of the limb's placement; then it becomes necessary to change that position to another where there is no pain. Make sure this new position is straight and even so that the limb does not become crooked upon restoration.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	The quality of the limb's immobilization that I recommend is as follows: you must know that broken limbs are diverse in their size, magnitude, and shape.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And for those who are small like the arm, fingers, and similar body parts, it is advisable that the wrapping be made with very soft cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	For those who are large like the thigh or leg, it is necessary that their wrapping be made with stiff and hard material, as strong binding connects a big limb firmly from all sides without leaving any gap.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	Then start your procedure and begin the evacuation of the equation by placing an appropriate soft padding on the site of the fracture, use three or four layers depending on how important the limb is; hold your hand slightly tightened with the bandage.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	Then go to the main part of fracture location and make sure that your binding is not stronger than what you used for securing the fracture site itself.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	Then extend your wrap around the fracture site slightly and loosen the binding gradually as you move away from this main part.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	Take another bandage and wrap it over this area that was wrapped once, then go to the part below the fracture; perform your binding operation as well as loosening of the wrapping in the same way we mentioned for the initial layer.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then place between the folds of cloth on his foot a piece of wood or fabric that conforms to the curvature of the fracture if there is any curvature, and otherwise, do not apply anything at all.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	Then place another bandage over them and conform it to these dressings, which have been appropriately and competently made, but do not apply any compresses if there is no inflammation or abscess present at this site. Instead, apply something that will reduce the abscess and remove the inflammation; then leave it for a few days before tightening up the bindings.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And let the bindings consist of reed matting on either side, expertly and carefully prepared; or they can be made from wooden slats, or palm fronds; and let each binding be as wide as this shape and pattern indicates:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, be sure that the slat which is placed over this fracture should be thicker and slightly shorter than the other bindings, with its length determined by the size of the limb to which it is applied; then tighten up these bindings again using another bandage in the manner I previously described, and tie them together above properly as we have said regarding tightness: the tighter your bindings are over the site of the fracture itself, and the looser they are further away from that point.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And make sure the strings are softer in thickness and delicacy, and they should be made of silk; and if the strings are thick, as I have seen some fools do by putting their strings from chords of the tortoise, it is a great mistake when they catch the tightness evenly.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And using very fine strings is not suitable because you will not achieve the desired tightness with them, and it should be ensured that there is no less than a finger's width between each string.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient's legs are said to be too thin at the ends of the strings, then place some soft linen or wool padding beneath them to prevent injury.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Sometimes a fracture occurs with an open wound, and there may be damage to the bone, which I will address in greater detail later in this chapter.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	Be aware that not every broken limb can be straightened with strings on the first day; this is because when a limb is large, it should not be straithed immediately but after several days or even weeks, depending on your confidence in preventing the development of an inflammatory abscess.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	This is the way of using plasters as the Ancients did to treat fractures, dislocations, and sprains.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Here is my line-by-line translation of the provided text:
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And confirm it like this, but filter it with egg white and let its preparation not be thick nor subtle; then use that.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another way to make a restorative plaster for fractures, dislocations, and sprains: Take assafetida, ladanum, acacia, enula (elecampane), and migrach which is the root of wild millet, all in equal parts; add 5 parts of myrrh and aloe, and 20 parts of aloes wood. Grind and sift them together, mix with vinegar water or egg white if the patient's wound is open. Then use this plaster, for it has a good composition and restores bones broken lightly, and many men testify to its effectiveness.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another method for a plaster that heals fractures and sprains: Take 10 parts of migrach (wild millet root), 5 parts each of marshmallow root, myrrh, and aloe, 6 parts acacia, and 2 parts Armenian bole.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	Grind all the ingredients in a mortar with some bruised glass until they are mixed together and sifted; add water or egg white and apply them to the patient.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Here is the translation of the first source sentence into English: 
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	Moreover, in this plaster there is no restorative vertut, but rather it serves as an abscess cautery and expels pain effectively.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another way to prepare a restorative plaster for blocked areas: take fresh fig leaves and wild poppy leaves; mix them together and make a plaster from these.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida i; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	A simplified method for applying a plaster to aid in the restoration of broken bones and when you seek resolution of residual abscess: take marshmallow root, chamomile, violet flowers, flax seed flour, all of these ingredients divided equally; blend them together with wine if the limb is not injured.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is injured, then prepare this with moist cilantro water or water only.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another more powerful way to plaster for resolution of a tough abscess that has occurred during the restoration of a limb: take marshmallow root, flax seed, balsam, mellilot, marjoram, violet flowers, chamomile, all of these ingredients divided equally; blend them together with willow water or regular water or wine, depending on the quality of the limb and its color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	Here is my best translation of the provided text: 
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	In Wales, it has been observed that they place wax on the broken limb to aid in its restoration and healing, and they use substances like myrrh, incense, and similar herbs, which have drying and heating properties, just as we mentioned earlier.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Recipe for a plaster to treat injuries and relieve pain: Take equal parts of ground wheat, pubic hair from a man or pigeon feathers, marshmallow root, and salt; grind, sieve, and mix these ingredients together to make the plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	The duration for which the bandage should remain in place depends on whether there is pain, swelling, or a broken bone; if none of these symptoms are present and the bone has not moved from its position, you may leave the bandage on for several days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	If there is severe pain, swelling, or inflammation at the injured site, then you must immediately loosen the bandage and remove the plaster from that area.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	Take a linen cloth and a moist sea sponge, dip them in lukewarm water, and use this to wash the affected area until the swelling and pain subside; then let the limb rest for an hour. Afterwards, place soft wool soaked in vinegar or rose oil over it, and bind it with bandages for one night, ensuring there is no festering of pus, and that the inflammation of the limb subsides while the pain is alleviated.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat that subtle stricture and apply a small plaster, do not tighten it with your initial constriction too much, and be gentle with that which is healing inside.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if you see that the abscess, scabs, pain, inflammation, and all symptoms have completely improved, and there is no need for plasters or constrictions anymore, then repeat the same treatment as you did in the beginning.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o vii; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if there is no further injury or cause to the member as we have mentioned before, then do not remove the bandage for three, four, five, or seven days; and sometimes it can be left for up to twenty days depending on how the healing of the member progresses, as we have explained, until the fracture heals, and the flesh coagulates over it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then adjust the constriction tighter than your initial one entirely, and accommodate the swelling of the patient's flesh according to their recollection.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	But if you see that the fracture site has already dried and become thinner than it should be, then know that nourishment is prohibited from reaching it; so pour tepid water over it every time you remove the bandage; and do this for a total of three days; slightly loosen the constriction, and through this operation, blood will flow to the member, and it will heal lightly.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	What these foolish bone setters do when they fail to treat a fracture at the outset as it should be treated and treat it instead in an unnatural way is a mistake on their part, causing great anxiety; if this were done correctly, the Ancients would have recorded it in their books and acted accordingly.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have never seen anyone among them do this, which is all the more reason not to attempt it.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter 2: On fractures that occur in the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The types of fractures are many, and their forms are diverse, with distinct causes. Some fractures occur due to the impact of space, where the impact drives all bone matter into the hollow at one end, similar to what occurs in wood; this type is known as axial fracture. Or the space cuts through a part of the bone, dividing it from its flesh without piercing completely through; such fractures are called absolute levations.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	The extent of damage in these two types of fractures can be severe or minor, and the third type is either an open or closed fracture; this results from impact with a blunt object or striking against stone, akin to each other.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is penetrating close to the bone marrow, which lies beneath the bone; or it is on the surface of the bone, and the wound caused by these two types of fractures can be large or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	When the fracture is within the bone, in the delicate and small area of the hairline, it is named this specific type of fracture 'capillar' due to its nature.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	A fracture caused by falling or being hit by a rock and similar objects, which drives a fragment of the bone into the nearby tissues, is made in a concave manner as happens with eggs when they are struck and their contents spill out internally.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	This type of fracture commonly occurs in the bodies of those with moist bones, such as children.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	All these types of fractures are considered bad, like separated stars.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	I will return to re-examine all these things in their place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	I know all these types of fractures by their appearance and through inquiries about how they occurred, as well as the presence of corrupted flesh over them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	Here is my translation of your text: 
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	Under the cure of fracture consider in the beginning the accidents of the patient, and if you see through these accidents that there is manifest signification of fear, such as vomiting with bile, fainting, loss of understanding, loss of voice, syncope, acute fever, expulsion of worms and rot of those, and similar accidents in serious conditions, know that it cannot be healed.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	If you see unusual accidents, wait for the healing process to begin; only then should you commence with the cure.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The reason is that if the patient has had a cold at the beginning of their illness, as they were struck in winter, you must look into bone exposure after 14 days according to all dispositions.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is in summer days, you must cut the bone away before day 7 to avoid corruption of the marrow beneath, and that the accidents we have recounted may occur.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has reached the marrow, covering the brain and is small and irregular in shape, you must incise that small, rough part as I will recount to you.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And when you shave the head of the infected patient, uncover the bone according to custom and as thoroughly as you can given the shape of the infection, and be gentle with the patient.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if you happen to detect bone, blood flow or abscess beneath it, you oppose them with what covers and fills the space, and you fill the area with cloths soaked in wine and rose oil, allowing the infection to rest until the abscess subsides, and you are sure there is no more bleeding; then begin with circumcising the bone and ablating it.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	This [procedure] is done according to one of two methods of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	One method involves cutting into the bone with a narrow saw like this one: Then apply another such instrument, slightly wider than that one; and this is its form:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And then use the wider saw over the previous one.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And see to it that you have several saws of various sizes, some wider than others; and some shorter than the rest with pointed ends, made of either iron or steel.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use them to assist in percussion over the incision so that you do not cut through the head and damage it.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	If the bone is strong and hard, then it is necessary to drill into its structure before you use the incisions with what are called non-penetrating trepans.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	They are not called this for no reason; it is because they do not reach the end of the bone structure beneath which lies the brain, hence the trepan has a rounded edge or margin over that which is left of the skull like an edge or small circle, prohibiting it from being submerged and passing through the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	It is advisable that you take a large number of these trepans, each suitable for the thickness of each bone structure, provided that its end is sharp and pointed, with an amount in length and width according to the degree of thickness of this skull.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	There are three types of trepans: The method of drilling into the bone structure is that you place the trepan on the bone and turn it with handles until you feel that the bone has been penetrated; then, change to another location and insert what is between all sides equal to or slightly more than the thickness of a ray. 
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And now you must be very cautious that the scissors do not touch any part of the abdomen.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And once you have encircled the perforating bone and separated it from the abdomen if it is still attached to it, you will extract that and then cut off its rough part with another instrument similar to scissors but which must be thicker and sharper than other scissors.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if any part of the small bones and arteries remains, take them easily with what you have for this purpose among your instruments; then treat the wound with ointments and unguents as we have mentioned.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	The other method of operation is gentle and far from fear, which Guy de Chauliac describes as highly praiseworthy; this is his description of it: 'It is necessary for you at the beginning to start uncovering the part of the bone in the place where the fracture is most forceful and most apparent, so that when you have uncovered that part and placed underneath its tip this slow and light pair of scissors whose shape is as follows:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	This is because the lens-shaped part is blunt and does not cut any tissues, while the sharp part has two edges going forward in length like this; let the lens-shaped part be adjusted to the abdomen by its sharp face towards the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	Here is my best attempt at translating the text:
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	For any other minor fractures and delicate breaks, it is necessary that you provide care based on what has been lost to correct the injury.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And this is why not all those who have studied this art will improve, especially in its practical application.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	This is what we've been discussing regarding major fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	If the surrounding tissue is torn when you extract the bone, then take a cloth of similar size to the wound and soak it in rose oil. Place this over the injury's surface; next, take another piece of folded or tripled cloth, soaked in wine and rose oil, and place that on top of the first cloth as gently as possible without harming the skin. Apply a bandage over everything and do not tighten it more than necessary to accommodate for swelling.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	Leave the dressing in place for a day or two until you are certain that the wound is free from infection; then remove it and apply medicines which promote drying such as linen root and bean flour, powder of hooves, and other similar substances.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And you must make these powdered medicines that are sprinkled onto the wound when it is dry; and generally administer any medicine whose property is to clean but not bite.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	Make sure that in your treatment the wound is clean according to its virtue; and it should not be covered with ointment or other things; nor let putrefaction settle into it; for when it settles on the brain membrane, it corrupts it, spreads there, and brings about an evil malignancy in the patient.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And it happens on the skull of the head when its bone is damaged and especially if its cure is delayed, and blackness appears in its surface; and then, if these accidents befall the patient that we have mentioned, know that it's extremely dangerous.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas iii, e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	If blackness does not occur except from the medicine applied on top of it and that medicine itself produces that blackness in virtue, then you should take some honey, three parts almond oil, and with these two mix a piece of cloth, and place this over the skull; and cure it with appropriate curative spices until healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	On the restoration of the nose when it is broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Know that the nose is not broken but rather split in two places where they come together, or one of those slightly covered parts, for it has two bones, and the part that is split is cartilaginous, it is not broken and does not happen to it other than attrition, tortuosity, and sinuosity.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	But if one of the two parts is broken, you should insert your little finger into their nose and adjust that fracture with your index finger inside while keeping your thumb outside until the nose returns to its natural shape.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And this should be done by you with ease, and take care not to cause the patient any pain during your operation.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the uppermost part of the nose and your finger does not reach it, then you should use the tip of a rod that has a small thick end.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two places, you should do the same thing.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And you should begin restoring the patient on the first day of the fracture, if possible; otherwise, wait until the seventh or tenth day to treat the abscess with rest.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	Then insert a piece of linen cloth at the end of the nose, if the fracture is in one part, or place two cow's bladders, if the fracture is in two parts, making sure they are filled to match the size of the nasal cavity.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	Some ancient healers recommend using bladders dipped in oil and changing them daily, but I have not seen this practice. Instead, cover the bladder with albumen from a boiled egg mixed with powder; then leave it in place until the bone is set and the cartilage has hardened.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	In some cases, you may insert a piece of soft wood into the nose instead of a bladder, especially if the fracture is severe and the patient can still breathe through their mouth.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	This method is not strictly necessary; you may choose to use wood or bladders as you see fit.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	If an abscess occurs again, apply a plaster made of wax or tallow soaked in vinegar and rose oil to the nose, or use 'diaquilon' (a type of medicinal preparation).
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	Here is my translation of the provided source sentence: 
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if there is an abscess inside the nose, you must cure it with caustic substances and insert lead tubes until it is completely healed.
Capitol .iiii.	This appears to be a reference to chapter four of a medieval medical treatise or text. It may indicate that the following information or instructions are part of a larger work, potentially providing specific guidance on various medical practices or treatments.
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	On the restoration of the jaw when it is broken." 
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the jaw is broken but there is no infection, first check if the fracture is only on the outside and not split in two, or bent at both ends; then its prognosis is favorable.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And so, if the fracture is on the right side, insert your left index finger into the patient's mouth; similarly, if it's on the left mandible, use your right index finger; with this, gently push the swelling of the fracture from within towards the outer ends, using your other hand to guide the outside of the bone; do so decently until it is aligned.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	If the jaw fracture is already split into two parts, then you must provide an extension of both parts according to their original straightness as much as possible for them to align.
